Nice place for breakfast yelp is making me right more or they won't post that I think this is nice place for breakfast.

To round out my reviews of all three Joe's-owned locations, Joe's Farm Grill in Agritopia is a casual, family-friendly restaurant with all the "favorites" if you will: burgers, pizza, barbecue, hot dogs, fried things...what else do you need? I mean, if it's been featured on "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives" and Guy Fieri approved it, it must be good. *sarcastic eye roll*  But to be real, Joe's Farm Grill is next level. Just to point out a few of my favorite things on the menu (though everything I've had here has been delicious), I love the Southwest Burger (topped with taco rub, pepper jack cheese, pico de gallo, chipotle mayo, and avocado), the Buffalo Chicken and Farm-Made Pecan Pesto Chicken Sandwiches, and any of the grilled pizzas or BBQ items--I realize that that's like a third of the menu but seriously all of these are bomb. The pizzas and barbecue are similar to what's available at Joe's other restaurants so you can't go wrong there and the Burgers, Chicken Sandwiches, and "Farm Favorites" are all welcome additions to the already delicious spread. Make sure to get either the Onion Rings (my personal favorite), Garlic Fries, or Sweet Potato Fries (which come with a delicious pineapple-serrano dipping sauce) on the side of whatever you order!  Aside from the food, I love the setting here too, with plenty of outdoor seating at picnic tables for nice days and room inside to eat when it gets too hot (or cold...but let's be honest with ourselves here, this is Arizona). The fountain drinks are all available outside as well as self-service dipping sauces for all the tasty fried things you're sure to order. Whether you're looking for a healthier meal or something decadent, Joe's Farm Grill has something for everyone!

The food is always fresh and portions are good sizes for the prices they charge. Cool atmosphere and a variety of options, this is a local favorite and worth the trip if your not from QC or STV. Hadve had multiple items that were all flavorful and cooked to order, if you are curious about the Ahi sandwich its great and super hearty, not some tiny little patty.

Saw this place reviewed by Guy on Diners, drive ins and Dives and thought we would try it and see what we thought! We pulled up and the line was about 30 deep but when we saw how fast it was moving we thought it wouldn't take long. It was worth the wait in line after we ordered they gave us a pager and within 15 minutes we had fresh amazing home made food and plenty of seating inside and out. We had breakfast and all I can say is pancakes the size of your head with home made sausage and potato fries. Oh and did I mention the home made lemonade and cheesecake. Great place we will be back

First time there and the food was okay and I didn't have to wait long for the food to be ready.  There were tables available but none of them were cleaned. There were tons of flies in the indoor eating area.   Seems like a good place to go to when it's cooler outside.

I love the Gouda burger & garlic fries !! Great  food , great location , great service!! I like the community farming co-op thing they have going too. great place for a family outing. We come here for birthdays and any other types of  large family events, somewhat of a tradition! We love this place!!! Sit outside under the beautiful trees and enjoy A meal with the family at the picnic tables! You can't beat this!

We met some friends here for breakfast and it's a great place. The grounds are amazing, the staff was pleasant and the quality of the food was great.  The quality of the food didn't translate into great taste. I had the French toast (my favorite) with eggs and it was good but honesty? I've had better tasting. I really wish I came for lunch and tried a burger, they look amazing.  They have a farm directly behind where some, if not all the food comes from. You can't get fresher than that!  The wait was crazy but it did move along.  I live in north Phoenix and would not come back due to the wait. I'm not going to drive an hour to wait an hour to eat. Just my 2 cents. If I was in the area for another reason, I would come and try a burger.

OMG!! I've been here MANY times. The burgers here are amazing. I love the fresh grilled taste they have. Their onion rings and French fries are addicting!! The milkshakes are also real and delicious! This is a place to go if you want some delicious burgers!

The char-crust on the burgers are friggin' ridonculous! Every bite is an explosion of flavorness and juiciness, and whichever other 'ness' you could imagine.  The Garlic fries here have utterly ruined any other chance that any other garlic fry out there would have-ever.  I have not tasted their equal anywhere! First taste brings me back to my childhood.  With it's escargot-like butter concoction, I lost my mind!  They get extra points for the pool of residue that collects at the bottom of the fry boat. My mouth is literally watering as I type...sigh  Chocolate shake rounds out the dining experience due to it's bombness! get a spoon, they're thickness.  Clearly they have more to offer, but I have found the magic equation and will stick to it.  The pizzas do look good however....

Joe's Farm Grill is a beautiful and tasteful environment! The line to order moves quick and your order is out in a jippy. Their Root Beer is one of the many things I go there for :) Any time  of the year works to be outside! Winter they have heaters, Summer they have plenty of shade and misters.

For all of the notoriety Joe's has gotten for being farm-to-table and all about the freshest ingredients, I - in my infinite wisdom - accidentally ordered something a meal that was entirely fried.  That's not to say the panko-breaded eggplant wasn't great, because it was fried well and came along with a great homemade marinara sauce. Similarly, the hushpuppies were equally excellent, made with pieces of actual corn for a little bit of texture. And the Friday fried cod was no slouch either, though given an upbringing where fish fries were the norm, the purity of ingredients approach did little to curb my ho-hum attitude.   It's easy to see why the line was out the door by the time I finished my meal - Joe's is a bastion of fresh food in a desert, but I advise those ordering to choose menu items that best highlight that freshness.

I absolutely love this place! The area, the atmosphere and the outdoor seating area is just so welcoming to me. I usually try to get as much as I can when I get here and then I end up playing myself and realize I can't finish all of the food. I highly recommend the bbq platter, garlic fries, and the hot dogs I can recommend the whole menu but then again you'd end up doing the same thing as me and not finishing all of it. One of of my favorite - cool places to go to with friends and hangout.   #CERTIFIEDBANGER

I LOVE THIS PLACE. I have been going here for years and the atmosphere is amazing and still not as great as the super fresh food. It's gotten a little crazy since the Food Network show (I was there the day after not realizing; and the line was INSANE) but it doesn't dissuade me. Especially when you can take a walk down the path after and burn off a few calories and scope out the farm itself.
Great, fresh-tasting food! Love the sweet potato fries!

For all those people whos experience was not so good at Joe's.  We have been going there for a long time! And Yes! The garlic fries are the hit of the menu, for that matter any menu. We have never had a bad meal ever! Maybe they ran out of tea a few times, but after mentioning it they fixed it right away. And as a group we have had most of the things on the menu. None ofwhich disappointed!

Good food, but long, slow lines when busy. I had the pulled pork sandwich with onion ring and both were delicious. My wife had a strawberry shake and a grilled cheese sandwich, which she enjoyed.  If you go when it's busy, leave a few people to save a table. You wait in line to place your order and then wait for your name to be called. A friend of mine who lives in Gilbert raved about this place and I always love going to places that appeared on Diners, Drive-in and Dives.  Scariest part about eating here: There are signs under the trees that warn about FALLING SCORPIONS! Yikes!

As I was heading to San Tan Village today with my parents to do some holiday shopping, we were all throwing out ideas of where to eat. I suggested that we try Joe's Farm Grill.  I have been hearing about this place for years, seen several news broadcasts, and hell it was even showcased on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  So I was actually wicked excited to try it.  My parents each got burgers.  The burgers  were nothing special, heh.  I got the Ahi Tuna sandwich.  My complaint about the tuna is that is what cooked too long.  It came to me cooked as if it was a medium rare burger.  The next thing that really frustrated me and was a huge dissappointment was the bun they served it on.  It was an everyday hamburger bun that you can buy at any supermarket.  Lame.  As far as the atmosphere of the place, bleh.  The interior was kind of bland, nothing special to look at.  What I will give props to is that you can watch your food being cooked.  Technically it's not an open kitchen because you watch through windows.  I mean everything tasted fine, but it's not a destination that I will go out of my way for.  If I'm in the area I will stop by and try it again, and hopefully with better results food wise.
Bomb.com nuff said!!! The bleu cheese burger and garlic fries with fresh strawberry lemonade. Worth the drive and money.

I finally visited all three of Joe Johnston's places. And I am stuffed. I've been going to Joe's BBQ since 1998, tried Liberty Market in November and finally on my birthday went to Joe's Farm Grill for lunch.   And got my meal for free! What a nice surprise.  Mike had the Double Dogs (2 hot dogs) with onion rings. The onion rings were so crispy and goooood. The hot dogs were decent. He said he would get them again. I would be willing to get them on another visit if they were covered in chili and cheese. I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and it was was absolutely delicious (I'm craving it right now just writing this review) with their regular french fries. The fries were also very good. Fresh and crispy. The burger was topped with cheese, BBQ sauce, an onion ring, bacon and blue cheese. Unbelievably good. And we couldn't pass up having milkshakes for dessert. You can pay for them at the time that you order your meal and go to the pick-up counter to get them when your done eating and bypass the line.   I loved all the outdoor picnic table seating and the huge tree in the back. The bathrooms are worth taking a look at. Just a little strange. The fireplace in the dining room is original to the house. It's a little dangerous that this place is so close to home. If you are coming during the lunch hour get here just before noon when it gets really busy.   I heard they will be having all kinds of specials in March to celebrate their appearance on "Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives," and their episode will re-run on the Food Network a couple of times in March also.

If you haven't tried this place then your missing out. I was introduced to this place over a year ago by my sister. One I came here for the first time on my birthday. I was suggested to get the fontina burger with a side of sweet potato fries and let me tell you....my tummy was very happy. Everything is made with their fresh veggies which is grown in their farm. Everyone should try out this place I know you will not be disappointed. Trust me. Make sure you try out their sweet potato fries. If Guy Fieri approves of then that tells u something. Go to Joes Farm Grill

If you want the breakfast or lunch hat trick of friendly, fresh food, and quick service, Joe's is your spot!  In a chain dominated area, Joe's is refreshingly old school and offers genuine authenticity.
Excellent food and great atmosphere. Place is always clean and a little customer service goes a long way. Favorite place to eat.

We LOVE Joe's Farm Grill! The building and grounds itself are reason enough to check it out, and the food is amazing. Head outside when the weather is nice and sit under one of dozens of huge, gorgeous old trees to enjoy your meal at a picnic table. The kids love running around in the grass and chasing the birds. The building has a cool history, if you're from the area and remember when the land was all farms. Try the hamburgers with grilled onions and the sweet potato fries- DELISH!!! Get there early for the lunch rush, as lines can stretch out of the building and down to the parking lot during spring and fall months. The staff is always courteous and the tables are sparkling clean. Even the bathrooms are kinda fun, with retro cartoons playing on small tv's in the walls. Make sure you hit them up on your birthday, for $10 towards your meal. Joe's Farm Grill is one of our favorite restaurants to visit when the weather is nice, and the Agritopia area is one of the most gorgeous spots in Gilbert. If you're looking for something different and want to enjoy the gorgeous spring/fall/winter weather, definitely head here!

Lunch at Joe's Farm Grill was a great idea!  I saw it on Food Networks Diners, Dives and Drive In's and it stuck in my mind as a place that I wanted to try. It was a bit of a drive from where I was staying in Chandler, but it was totally worth it. Before stepping a foot into the restaurant, we fell in love with the grapefruit trees surrounding the building, such a cute area with a lot of outdoor seating. I ordered the special of the day, which was a grilled salad.  It was Romaine lettuce, topped with bacon, tomatos and blue cheese. Oh mama... so damn good. BUT what made me stop in my tracks was the GIANT slice of lemon- seriously it was almost as big as my hand. The salad was really good, and since it was grilled, it gave a nice smoky flavor but it was not over powering.  My only complaint is that we only ate their once.  They had plenty of items on their breakfast and lunch menu that I wanted to try.   I like that they use local ingredients when they can and look for healthy ingredients (natural beef for the burgers and transfat free oils)

I don't understand what the hype is all about. I waited in a line that was out the door and gotten eaten my mosquitos outside. I love that they are local and serve locally grown food but it's not worth the wait in line.
This place does everything right. From breakfast to dinner, hands down, this place can't be beat.  Joe's big breakfast and their fontina burger are two of my favorites.
The atmosphere is really nice, all clean everywhere, nice places to seat inside and outside, food  really good! Good quality, fresh ingredients! Please try the sweet potato pie! You won't regret it

Delicious food with dog friendly patio. I had the grilled chicken pesto on the gluten free bun.w fries. The chicken was topped with diced grilled red peppers and mushrooms with a pecan pesto sauce. The sliced tomato was garden fresh. Yunmy!! Nice employee brought out a dish of cold water for our dog.  First time here, will definitely return.  Beautiful old trees provide nice shade!

As usual I loved my favourite BBQ. This time I had the sliced brisket.  This was so yummy the crust in the meat was perfect and very little fat. I discovered the cheesy potatoes my new favourite side. I actually think the other sides are not so good   The only consistent downside of the meal is the bread. What ever they spray on the grill or the bread just leaves a really bad taste on the bread. The bread would be a wonderful vehicle to sop up extra sauce but the taste of the oil (whatever it is ). Leaves such a bad taste I usually throw the bread away. I always get the bread in hope the bad taste has gone
This place is THE place to go for a good burger. The tuna burger is great too... just about everything is fresh from the farm out back. Mmmm.... the sweet potato fries...

Full disclosure I haven't been back in over a year but that doesn't represent how much I enjoyed Joes. As soon as you walk in the aroma welcomes you with a sweet barbecue hello. I have been thinking about Joes non stop and can't wait to get back. Keep it simple and get a slab. Mac and Cheese is good and the beans hit the spot.  Picnic like set up for dining but it has its charm.
So yummy! We had the BBQ pork sandwich, fried zucchini, burger, strawberry lemonade and vanilla milk shake. Everything was perfect! We really enjoyed their homemade ranch!

So if you ever been to Joe's in downtown Gilbert you know they have great food. Well same goes for this place! More diversity on the menu as far as not everything being bbq. Really quality ingredients, food takes some time, but that's okay! You gotta wait for good food :)

I love this place! You can definitely taste the quality and freshness of their ingredients! I love their fontina burger and pesto chicken. It is my favorite. Make sure you try their milkshakes as well. The place is nice and peaceful. Great for family outings

This is a neat place...we really like the farm to table concept.  Food was fresh and very good and service friendly.  The day we were there happened to be their annual customer appreciation day so we ended up having a burger (only option that day) as well as 3,200 other people.  Will definitely go back but next time not on such a busy day.

Everyone should eat here once.   It was a little bit more expensive than I expected but I mean the food was great.   I ordered the special which was like a bacon cheeseburger that day & my Fianceé got ribs (which i ate half of) .  Would HIGHLY recommend the ribs & sweet potato fries.
The burgers and fries are amazing. I really like how you can get $10 off your meal on your birthday. The atmosphere is fun, modern, and the staff is helpful even when its crowded.

Amazing food, atmosphere, and employees. I only gave 4 stars because it does get crowded all the time. There is enough seating to accommodate tons of people when it's crowded but the line just goes on forever out the door.

I came to Joes Farm Grill to try their breakfast, which I'd never had before but had been wanting to try for a while. The first time I came here was with my sister during the week so it wasn't too busy. She got the new biscuits and gravy which she said she liked, and I ordered the pancakes with berries. These pancakes are so good! The flavor is great, they're on the thin side which I like, but they also had a slight crisp on the edges which was perfect! The berries were nice and fresh and it came with plenty of them.  The second time I came here was a few weeks after on a weekday, so again, it wasn't too busy. I told my parents about the pancakes and they wanted to try them as well, so we all ordered them! They tasted the same as the first time I had them, so Joes has proven to be very consistent. The price is also very reasonable, and I love the new remodel! It is much more spacious and open and a really nice place for families. Look forward to trying more of their food!

I used to love this place, it was like coming home for breakfast.  Unfortunately it's lost its charm. Service is seriously lacking, food is mediocre and there are huge air vents blasting cold air on your food (even in the winter)  It's extremely frustrating to be served cold syrup for your pancakes ( that are also being blasted by cold air) cold air, cold syrup, cold pancakes, cold food.   The dining room smells like musty carpet. It seems they've lost interest in making this place great. I seriously doubt that Triple D would ever visit this place again.  The outside is nice but not worth paying for overpriced food just for picnic charm.  I'm sure this could all be remedied with some decent management.  Truly sad.  I gave it a 2 because the last three visits have been nothing but disappointing.

I've been here many times over the years. Always a place I go back to. The food quality can't be beat. It's casual yet the food is not your standard fast food. It's actually good and good for you! When I had family visiting, I brought them here for lunch. We came once again for dinner the following day since they loved it so much!
Absolutely worth driving 45 miles for great food! Food is fresh and delicious. If you're looking for a new place to try and want a different ambience this place is a must!

I probably just ate half pieces of the best cheesecake I ever have! Unfortunately I asked my husband if he wanted to share it and he said YES.  But it's better for my waist line.  You can tell by the weight of the cake.   The grilled wild salmon was cooked to perfection. The beet salad,  so good.  The French fries were a bit salty.   Next time I ready have my eyes on the pumpkin pies!

Trying Joe's in Gilbert AZ. Thought this was going to be a small place, on the contrary it's large with indoor and outdoor seating and surrounded by 40 acres. Hence the farm in the name. Place was busy with line out side. To the food, ordered the lamb burger stuffed with goat cheese. Not a big fan of lamb, but this was truly tasty. No gamy flavor at all. Perfectly grilled topped with some greens, a delicious treat. They have several homemade sodas to choose from. The prices were average for the area and the atmosphere was very friendly. If your out this way, head to the farm. BTW this is a Triple D joint
Love it here! My favorites are the chicken pesto sandwich & the bbq chicken pizza! The wait in line is worth it! The atmosphere is wonderful & u must check out the bathroom (trust me)!
Fantastic. Did not disappoint. I have never ever ever had a bad meal here. My personal favorite is the mahi mahi sandwich. They just do it right and it's not easy getting good fish in Arizona.

Finally a great place to eat by my house. We moved from California and have struggled with the new food options in Arizona by comparison. This place however did not disappoint.  Fresh food with good portion sizes!  The only wierd thing is they have dolls in the bathroom..... super creepy... not sure what thats about lol.

Went here with my fiancé for a surprise date and omg so yummy. Always get the lemonade (there's like 4 types ) the people there are very friendly and nice. Also the burgers are big but not overpriced like other places. Always a good time when we come here.

Great food and worth the wait!  The line can be a little ridiculous but I will say that it wasn't as bad because an employee came out and educated us all about the menu item's and the daily deals. Hence the Burger for Two, which really could've fed four!!  The deal also included side of fries, coleslaw, one slice of tomato (not enough for that big burger), lettuce, some onion, and a few bites of cheesecake. Overall it was all very good!!! Price was decent too, cheaper then us both getting two separate orders of burgers and fries. My favorites are the Farm burger, sweet potato fries w the yummy pineapple goodness it's served with, and the Date Milkshake!!! Not so good was the Chicken salad sandwich, it was just meh.  The flies were a nuisance but what do you expect when the seating is mainly outside. No complaints here though, Joe's Farm Grill gets two thumbs up from me!  Note:  We got that burger about 3 months ago so not sure if it is a regular menu item.

Awesome healthy options for breakfast. The strawberry lemonade was so refreshing. We ate outdoors but options to eat inside as well. The omelet was very filling it came with a salad and side and a biscuit or coffee cake. The farm scramble was great as well will definitely come back -staff very friendly
Best BBQ in SW by far! Family owned, great service, Old school. Luv the slider sampler and don't forget ur free meal on your birthday!

Wow!!! Joe's is amazing.  My husband ordered the lamb burger and I ordered the jumbo shrimp.  The food is prepared with love and care. Fresh veggies and for sides. The onion rings were delicious.  So, looking for a fresh spot with great customer service,  eat here!

My daughter and I just went there, thought we would try it again, and again, it was just....ok.  I had the ahi tuna sandwich and Megan had the cheeseburger.    The ahi sandwich came with this wonderful slaw on it, the best thing about the whole meal, very fresh and crunchy with a good flavor.   I took a bite of the tuna by itself and it was pretty much tasteless.  Would have been better if I'd poured salt on it (no more, high blood pressure you know).   Megan's cheeseburger was a little above average, mostly due to the thick slices of bacon that came with it.  French fries were ok, and the food was just kinda warm, at least Megan's was.  Mine, however, was not.  Bun was almost cold.  I don't think I'll be going here again.  For the price we paid for two meals ($25) it wasn't worth it, and this is the second time I have had just an "ok" experience here..
Delicious and awesome staff ! I love the options to be able to sit outside on the picnic tables. You have got to try their garlic fries!!

Found Joe's Farm on the list of places visited by DDD.   Unfortunately, the food was nothing special and not worth the cost of gas from Scottsdale.    We had the Thai Chicken Salad and the pork ribs/pulled pork combo.  The Thai Chicken salad came with 2 small grilled chicken breast, assorted greens, sugar snap peas, bean sprouts, sliced radishes, shredded carrots and celery along with a Thai vinaigrette dressing.  You could barely taste the dressing and it really didn't add much flavor.  The combo came with coleslaw and French fries.  We upgraded to onion rings for an additional $2.50.  Definitely worth the extra cost.  This was the best part of the meal.  The ribs were on the dry side, although the meat did sort of fall off the bones. The pulled pork was so so.  At least, the meat was moist.  Overall we were disappointed given all the hype.  Guess it won't be necessary to check  out the sister rib joint.

I've been twice now and enjoyed it both times.  The flies were a little out of control last time, but I don't think this is always the case.    I LOVED my fontina burger and the sweet potato fries (and pineapple dipping sauce) are divine! I've also tried the Bleu Cheese Burger and it was REALLY good.  I'd order them both again.  I don't think there is anything on the menu that I wouldn't try.   We waited in line once for about 5 minutes (the line moved fast) and the next time there was no line at all.  Luckily when there is a line they have menus for you to look through so you are completely prepared when you get to the window.

why is this place so far away??  we ordered a burger, the grilled chicken sandwich, fries and onion rings. we topped it off w a fresh strawberry shake since it was the special for the day.   we split everything and boy oh boy was it great! I have also heard that their pizza is awesome and their breakfast. I need to go back and get both.  also, don't forget to check out the bathroom. i think i spent like 15 minutes in there. lol jk. it is pretty entertaining though.

Located in Gilbert, AZ (East Valley). Been going here for over 10 years. Excellent food and service. Price is comparable to Red Robin.  You get anything from breakfast, burgers, ribs to salmon salad and seafood plates. Great family atmosphere. On your birthday they give you $11.00 to apply towards any meal.

Lots of hype around this place, lines all the way out the door all the time... The first time I ate here, I had the Fontina Burger, and was quite underwhelmed.  I also had the date shake, which had barely any date in it.  I didn't want to write the place off, however, since Joe's Real BBQ is one of my favorite restaurants.  This time, I went with the hot dogs: Carolina and Sonoran.  The Carolina dog sounded pretty good, with its pulled pork, BBQ sauce, and slaw toppings.  It was decent, but not as awesome as I thought it'd be.  The franks seemed to be decent quality, and the buns were nice.  If you get a dog, this is probably the best option.  Now, I knew going in that the Sonoran Dog would not be an authentic Sonoran dog.  Sour cream?  Really?  But I tried it anyways, hoping it would at least be good, even if not a Sonoran Dog.  It was underwhelming; seriously, guys, at least make it spicy.  If it doesn't even have that in common with a real Sonoran Dog, why is it called that?  A Sonoran Dog has pinto beans, bacon, mayo, mustard, pico de gaullo, tomatillo sauce, is served on a bolillo roll, and is served with a grilled hot pepper.  You can't just slap some bacon and beans on a hot dog and call it a Sonoran Dog.  This should be a crime.  This is a blatant affront to all of the hardworking Mexican immigrants who, through their efforts, created Arizona's finest contribution to the culinary landscape.  The outdoor seating is nice.  That's really about it.  They don't even have the awesome homemade root beer or lemonade they have at Joe's Real BBQ. Skip this, and stick with Joe's other restaurants.

Been to Joe's as far back as a couple of years ago and as recently as yesterday. The atmosphere is ideal if you are visiting Gilbert as it is the perfect representation of this town (farmy, sunny, a lot of real estate). The food is great as well. My Only complaint is the pricing. It can be a bit pricey compared to the market. Other than price, everything is fantastic. Will be back soon!

A cute place with average food that is one of the few left to allow pets...and that's the reason you come here.  I'm not sure why so many rave about such average food, but it makes for a nice setting and a spring/summertime lunch.  Maybe if I had the cheesecake I'd be in a better mood ;)

First time here. Wasn't overly impressed with the food, but even less impressed with the amount of flies in the restaurant. The whole time we had to swat flies away. Hueveros DE ranch were okay at best and served a little cold. :(probably won't go back. Sad because it's such a cute place.

I've been in this establishment a couple times and it never disappoints. The food is always fresh and made from great ingredients. The staff is friendly and accommodating and it's a nice family environment.  We came here recently for Mother's Day and I had the special of the day: coconut macadamia nut white chocolate chip pancake. I don't like white chocolate so I asked if they could substitute regular chocolate chips and they did! They get busy on the weekends but it's worth the wait.

We came here when visiting my mom in Chandler. I had to check it out since my hero from the food channel, Guy Fieri came here.  I had the house special bbq chicken pizza which has a ton of flavor and a nice grilled thin crispy crust. Mmmm. Highly recommended! Wifey and mom had salad which was fine. Supposedly they grow everything on site in their farm so the veggies are always fresh.   Overall the food is good, nothing spectacular but its definitely good. Service was friendly, which is very important to me!  They have picnic tables outside you can eat on, which is nicer than the plasticky 'school cafeteria' furniture thats inside.  I'll probably come back here on my next visit to AZ to try some of their other stuff.

The wife and I didn't like it, for the money, it wasn't worth it. She had the curry chicken sandwich which really didn't pop with curry flavor and I had the buffalo chicken sandwich which was overpowered by the bleu cheese sauce and I like bleu cheese. We got there right at the transition from breakfast to lunch so we got the kids an overpriced breakfast and got ourselves an overpriced lunch. The only reason I give it two stars is the atmosphere.
This is one of my favorite places to eat. Little pricey,  but the food is really good. I really enjoyed the watermelon contest they did on memorial day weekend.  Very fun and creative.

Our family loves this place. Awesome and delicious fresh food. It's also pretty affordable. We love sitting outside and our daughter loves using their kid tables outside. Beautiful place in a beautiful area!!

Location on the actual farm...now thats farm fresh.  Very casual, Very clean.  Food is the typical Dinner experience but its nice to know that Joe's farm grill makes the effort to use farm fresh products whenever possible.    My husband loved the pancakes.  You can tell the cakes are from scratch rather than a mix, plus, they are griddle fried,  not just cooked brown on both sides (if you know what I'm talking about then you know how much of a difference it makes) and they use real maple syrup without having to ask.  you can also tell the eggs are higher quality than grocery store eggs...score.  It will be interesting to come out and have dinner during a time of year when more farm produce is in season.  I look forward to harvest time!

We have been coming to this place for several years and we keep waiting for it to improve and it never really does. The food is just "ok" and we really only come here because there is a large grassy area where kids can run around and play while you wait for your food. This is a huge draw because it takes the stress out of having to keep your kids corraled the entire time. We've had the chicken tenders (strange), fish (ok), grilled cheese (the best thing we've had here), corn dogs, the BBQ platters (dry) and several other things in between. It's not that the food is bad....it's just not good - it's OK.  Our kids love to come and run around with other kids and that is the only thing that keeps us coming back.

Simple but so good! I've been coming here since I was a Sophomore in High School and every time I'm back home I have to come here! This place was on Food Network for a reason, because of the simple and fresh menu they have that will not disappoint! I try to get something different here every time I go, and have yet to come across something I didn't like. Using ingredients from their own farm, and BBQ from Joe's Real BBQ.  The burgers are delicious and fresh, the Fontina burger is a local favorite but the Bacon Blue Burger is right there too if you want something more meaty! The Grilled Chicken Pizza is a great choice if you're a fan of grilled pizzas. Do NOT miss your chance to eat the onion rings here, possibly the best onion rings you'll ever eat! Be sure to try out their Strawberry Lemonade to wash it all down, you won't regret it!   The only area I could vote this place down is the wait time. Come at prime lunch or dinner times and expect to wait for a good minute just to order. However, the wait is well worth it, and won't keep you from coming back!

We went for an early dinner yesterday. We had the bacon blue cheese burger and the garlic Gouda burger with garlic fries and sweet potato fries. Basically the environment is super relaxed, the staff is super nice, the place is clean and efficient but the important part is these are probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and seasoned and HUGE. We will definitely be back!

I am definitely a fan of Joe's Farm Grill.  My bf and I went on a Sunday morning for breakfast and we were definitely pleased.  You order at a counter, find a table and wait for your buzzer to beep when they are ready.  The place was CROWDED with a ton of parents & kids, which was kind of annoying but hey, just because I don't have kids doesn't mean others aren't allowed to ;)  I had the Joe's Big Breakfast and my bf had the meat & potatoes .... everything was delicious.  Just make sure you're dressed for the weather because you are likely sitting outside at one of their picnic benches.

The first time I went to Joe's Farm Grill I got the Fontina Burger (hands down this is my favorite burger, maybe ever) and baked potato fries (fries topped with cheese, sour cream and bacon). That meal was SO delicious, it's what I keep getting every time I go back. One of these days I might have to try something else off that menu!   My meals there have always been consistently fresh and tasty. The shady outdoor picnic seating makes for a fun family outing. You can practically taste the nostalgia. I love how they have repurposed the family farmhouse.   Parking, seating and the service concept can be frustrating when they are busy. And it seems like they are always busy, and with good reason. :-)

I've been more than once, so it is a place I would recommend going to at least one time. I think this place however is a bit over-rated just because it was on TV. To me it seems like diner food but with better ingredients, but I guess that's the point. It's the kind of place, if I rolled up and one of the obscene lines were forming, I would go somewhere else.   Eating outside, where the majority of the seating is located, is a pain. We had a ton of flies around last time, which my daughter kept freaking about. So we try to stick to the limited inside seating. We've also had 2 orders incorrect in the past, which were corrected, just not ideal when a hungry 3 year old is in the mix. Another downside is they do not serve alcohol, so a beer with a decent burger is out of the mix, and frankly seems just wrong.  I will say this is a neat place to take the kids, and yeah will go back for them and my wife who really likes the veggie burgers. Service is always friendly and even when it's busy they seem to be pretty quick with food delivery. And the food is actually pretty tasty and menu is pretty good selection wise. It's comfort food, so don't be fooled with the "Farm Grill" title thinking it's a healthy option, I have yet to try a salad there, but they do sound good from the menu.  When it comes down to it there are just better options in my opinion. Guess I'm on Joe's fence, hence the middle of the road rating.

We came here expecting it to be the end all be all of restaurants, considering it was on TV and if you speak to most people, they say how great it was. This was not the case in our experience. We can definitely do without. It was packed and not enough seating to hold all of the customers they had, so sitting outside in the cold (this was in early March), was not going to happen.
Good food and nice outdoor tables.  Prices fair and the beet salad is terrific!

Line is soooooo long.  Especially on the weekends.  They need more registers.  Staff tends to seem kind of burnt out all the time.  However, the atmosphere is great and the food is so fresh and delicious.  We love sitting outside under the big trees looking out on the farm.  It is kind of romantic and low key.

Love the food. Hate the flies and flimsy napkins. Lines are long on weekends. Forget about trying to get breakfast on a weekend with less than a 45 min wait! Best time to go is evenings and early morning workdays. The fresh squeezed OJ Is super expensive but so delicious. Lots of variety in menu.

The food is delicious and you can taste how fresh it is. I would say that the prices are justified. I would love to come here more often just for the vibe of the place and the nice people that work there, but the place is a little to pricey to be just a casual hang out. I've been here a couple of times and i've been pleased with the food 100% of the time

This little jewel is not to be missed. Their food is fresh and tastes like what you wish you could have on family picnics and barbecues - simple, delicious, and filling! I had a hard time choosing something because I wanted everything they offered. I had a great time sharing plates with my friends and sighing after every bite (no joke). The food is the staple to a restaurant, but here at Joe's, the environment is as well. The decor is fresh and modern, yet feels completely unintruding. If it's nice outside, sit near the huge trees and then take a walk by the garden nearby. In general, this place is full of happy, and I felt like a kid eating at a banquet. My favorite part? It might sound a little weird, but the bathrooms are the coolest. Expect a few surprises when you walk inside.

I really loved the dining experience here from start to finish. The food was very good and fresh.  I would recommend the sweet potato fries especially. So good. As a matter of fact, the veggies on my plate were what stood out, which is unique. I brought my children as well and they were happy & I felt comfortable With them in the restaurant.

We really only come here on special occasions due to the slightly high prices and long wait in line.  Even though I always say I am going to try something new on the menu, I end up getting a burger, fries and milkshake.  They are all really good.  When the weather is nice, we really enjoy sitting outside on the benches.
Delicious BBQ pork, awesome scenery, you can sit inside or outside there is their farm all around the restaurant.  If you are within 40 mins of here you should make the trip!

I'm going to go against the grain on this one. I think the food is decent but nothing special. We've tried various items but haven't  found anything to come back for. When we do go there it's with guests who saw it on TV and want to give it a try. The environment is kinda cool if you don't mind all the flies.

I went here after I saw a friend post this on facebook after it was on Triple D!  I went there around 8:30pm on a Saturday night right before they were closing and it was still packed, waiting a good 15 mins just to order.  What I got Fontina Burger with onion rings- Excellent Grilled BBQ Chicken Pizza - Somewhat tasty but I was full from my burger Vanilla Shake - The blue cherry hit the spot  Also had a bite of the Peanut Butter and Banana sandwich which is somewhat great but I couldn't eat it as a meal.  If I went to Phx, I would highly recommend this place
I have been a few times and I really just don't get the hype. I really like Joe's Farmhouse Grill though!!!

We have eaten here about 20 times. After the remodel we're dealing with some pretty heavy lines now. The 'next level' mentioned is regarding pricing as we paid $37 and change for 2 burgers, one of them a combo and 2 sodas total. Thirty Seven Dollars. For that amount Ill be grocery shopping for a 3 day haul. I get it it's organic, most of everything they serve comes from the farm within a stone's throw of the restaurant and the meat is local. I am always confused as to why when that is the case, things are so much more expensive. I think restaurants are starting to realize in Gilbert that although people are flocking here to save money, that they have money to burn as a result and so raising the prices of what you would normally pay for up to maybe 20% above what the actual value...25% above actual value maybe, are what people are going to pay and they are. Now there are very long lines here depending on when you go and they've quite the nostalgic feel in the bathroom too. This place does very well but for two hamburgers and two sodas and an order of fries for $37 & change, there are other places in the town that I wouldn't mind stepping down a half star in order to get two to three times as much food should I want it. So Joe's will become our quarterly place to eat simply because it's just too expensive to eat here regularly. I do want to mention that the entire staff and management is nice though.

Love this place.  Great burgers and their grilled salmon and pizzas are delicious.    Heard about this place while reading reviews on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.  Is that what put this place on the map because it definately appears to be a tourist destination on weekends.  Lines can be long depending on time of visit.  Indoor seating is limited but plenty of space outdoors.  Bring a blanket, find some shade under a tree and chill out (or use one of their many picnic tables.    I have returned often but will usually drive on by if lines are out the door.

It's a great place to have lunch outside this time of year(March). We tried several menu items. The rib meal was yummy, as was the Sonoran Dog, garlic fries, and onion rings. The grilled wedge salad was satisfactory as well as the pepperoni pizza. Be prepared to spend between$12-$15 a person. It was a nice place to try, but nothing I will drive over an hour to again.

I was visiting my parents for Father's Day Weekend and always wanted to take them to Joe's after seeing it on Food Network. It was great! The ahi tuna sandwich totally lived up to what I saw on the show! Everyone loved their food and we will definitely be back again one day!

What a lovely place.  Great environment for families with cooled outdoor seating.  Ribs and BBQ platter were excellent!  Ribs were fall off the bone and the sauce was wonderful.  Side dishes very good.  We look forward to coming again.
Joe's Farm Grill is one of the cutest spots in Gilbert!  Agritopia is adorable.  The food is good, but not incredible, especially for the price.  But, the atmosphere makes it all worth it!
Yumm so good and pleasant! Geat place for  after winning a soccer tourney!!! Gooooooal!!!!!!!

The food is fresh, and is a fairly decent portion size. My only two issues are that it is way, way overpriced, and rather bland. I've been to this place 4 times and tried different dishes and came away feeling the same each time. Great atmosphere though.

The seating is cafeteria style. I ordered a burger plain, no bun. It was okay not wonderful. I also ordered fried extra crispy with cheese on top. I was finished eating my burger by the time I got my fries not extra crispy with a very light sprinkle of rock hard shredded cheese.  The young woman (teenager) behind the window could not hear me or my husband when we were ordering our food, we had to repeat what we wanted over and over again.

I was in the mood for tacos, but there aren't many taco hotspots in Gilbert so we decided to lean back on to reliable Joe. I've never had a bad meal here and the streak continues. Today I tried the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, without the bleu cheese and they forgot to give us the celery that is supposed to come with it. We didn't realize that until we got home, but i really would have loved that celery. I was splitting the sandwich with my gf and asked to have the sandwich cut in half and when i got the sandwich they told me there were knives around the corner...essentially saying, "do it yourself." Not a huge ordeal, but still would've been nice if they went the extra mile.  All in all the sandwich had a good spicy kick to it, exactly what I needed. We got fried zucchini as the side and the breading that came with it was perfectly crusted. Definitely went well with the marinara sauce, but I always prefer ranch with my fried products.   When we first got here, the line was out the door and pretty long. But, the line went by fast - really only waited 15 minutes or so and then we got our food in about 10 minutes...so it wasn't as bad as we thought it was going to be. And while you wait, you know you'll be greeted with tons of little children running around with sticks whapping trees and tables...so it gives you a good opportunity to judge other people's parenting.

This place is pretty legit. The food is super fresh. You order at a window and they bring it to you. No alcohol but plenty next door at the brewery. High priced for the serving you get, but its all farm to table. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Cool place to bump elbows with someone new and make/meet friends. I'd definitely go back for their burgers.
I had the Salmon Caesar Salad yesterday for lunch and lets just say it's my new pregnancy craving! It was amazing! :)

I loved Joe's Farm Grill...you haven't lived until you have tried the Blue Cheese Burger..(not sure what it is named on the menu)...I fancy steak encrusted with blue cheese, this burger is the next best thing.  Their garlic fries are to die for...heck, everything they cook is incredible...worth the drive...

With 40 people already writing reviews: WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?  It is a simple place, much more diner than restaurant, you stand in line to order then pick up when your number is called. But the food is great. Wonderful salads and a fantastic grilled ahi tuna.  And did you hear, they grow their own veggies.  Would Guy or me ever lead you wrong?

I can't believe that I lived less than ten minutes from Joe's for almost five years and ate here once...WTH?  I guess the location off Higley and Ray wasn't along my normal route, otherwise I would have been a regular for sure.  I'm spending the day with my Golden Retriever, Chloe Rose, so after a walk around the park and a stop off at the doggie juice bar for Mutt Muffins and Yappy Yogurt, I needed a decent spot for lunch that would allow the princess pooch to hang out with me.    The atmosphere at Joe's is really cool and very unique...it was portrayed well on the Food Network's "Triple D"  It's modern, kindof rustic and not Arizona at all.  Gotta love the TV playing cartoons and the Barbie Dolls/GI Joe figurines in the unisex restroom.    We ordered the signature BBQ chicken pizza (the bomb) and the Grilled Chicken Sandwich (one of the best I've ever had) which is HUGE....I ordered it on a multi-grain bun with blue cheese and "upgraded" to garlic fries which were to die for...seriously dripping with garlic and parmesean cheese.  I must also mention the pickles which were awesome...so fresh tasting since the cucumbers are locally grown.   I like that the condiments are self-serve along with the beverages.  I cannot wait to get back here for breakfast next weekend :)

Four of us went Saturday evening, and I was excited to find several open tables inside and little wait to order.  It's a really neat building with a great story, appealing to my love of things local, natural, and organic.  Although....however natural my grilled cheese and french fries were, I'm sure they weren't healthy!  Definitely delicious with the texas toast, and a chocolate shake to top it off!  The boyfriend enjoyed the BBQ Bacon Blue Burger and garlic fries, although I had to stay away from him after that because those were stroooong!    I'm not sure it's a good place to go on a date, since yes, there were plenty of kids around and this was just a Saturday evening.  In fact, several were playing in the ditch as we went to leave.  I can only imagine a weekend morning.  Great if you have kids since there's lots of outdoor space to run around in, not so great if you don't want to hear it.    Overall, a unique and pleasant addition to Gilbert!

I say, "Thai Chicken Salad," and "would go back if nearby."  I thought the sign warning that anyone doing commercial photography would be charged with trespassing was strange. There must be a story here.

Food is good, but someone needs to be here to watch the gaggle of 17 year olds that don't give a shit about their jobs. Customer service isn't terrible but I don't know if they are pretending to be slow or are actually slow.
We love this place nice atmosphere good fresh food never a disappointment. Always nice to be able to let the kids run around in the grass on a beautiful day on their grounds

The farm grill is soooo good. I think the food is quite superior to the bbq joint. I love the bbq chicken pizzas,-and the green eggs and ham for breakfast! I've actually never tasted anything bad here. The burgers are really good as well.

Well, I wish this place was worth it.  The food was good compared to the typical stuff can find this far out into the east valley, but it wasn't mind blowing.  I tried the famous fontina burger, and it was decent.  It wasn't worth the huge wait to get it.  Standing in line for 40 minutes just to order isn't really worth a burger to me.  The ingredients were fresh, and I could tell that they were high quality.  If someone wanted to eat there again then I would, but I wouldn't go on my own again.  It wasn't anything special enough to wait that long to order.  It's what I would refer to as just vanilla.  What I mean by that is it might be good or fun to you... If you are a Mormon.

The Ahi Tuna Sandwich was delicious. The meat was cooked perfect and was high quality. I get a similar sandwich when I go to the yard house and let me tell you this sandwich puts the other one on Mcdonalds status. The Milkshakes were just typical milk shakes but you could taste the more quality ingredients. The line was long but moved rapidly. This place is great!
Great food!  BBQ pizza and fontina burger wonderful.  Need more places like this closer to home!

The fontina burger & garlic fries are amazing!! (& always my go to) Staff is always friendly (the manager even helped me find a salon because she took the time to find out I was new to the area... And my hair looked terrible hence why I was diving face first into a fontina burger & garlic fries )

As you can probably perceive from the picture I took, the restaurant has a beautiful atmosphere that's as fresh and vibrant as the food they serve! Plenty of outdoor seating and even some indoor seating for restaurant goers.   It was a after noon but it was still crazy busy, so be prepared that there are many other people that know about and want to enjoy this yummy food! It's well worth the crowd in my opinion. I had the fish fry special and sure enough this was flaky hand breaded and well seasoned fish. I don't like ordering fish in AZ, however, the food here looked so good and fresh and so many people ordered it, I gave it a try. What I really enjoyed were the corn fritters that were full of flavor and so crunchy on the outside! Inside were while corn kernels that added a nice texture and pop of sweetness to the hush puppy. The fries and slaw didn't disappoint!   They do have desserts as well but I was too full to try any... Next time Joe's! :) I'll be back!

The food is really good, nice and fresh and the burgers are great. I did knock a couple stars off since the past few times I have called in a phone order the person has been extremely rude. In addition, they will have a line winding through the restaurant, out the door, to the street and still only have one person taking orders. I love the atmosphere and that its family friendly, but I'm not willing to put up with subpar service and waits over 30min just to put in an order. There are so many other great places in Gilbert now that Joe's had better get this under control. Especially the service. I called today to put in a phone order and heard the girl verbally go "ok ugghhhh." Really?!?!

I love the food at Joe's Farm Grill. I haven't had a bad meal yet. They provide open outdoor seating areas that are pet friendly. It's great place to stop after coming from Cosmos Dog Park just down the street. :)  For those of you that like to eat flour tortillas with your breakfast.... guess what, they don't have them. The gal at the register looked at me like I was speaking a foreign language when i asked for one. They do have tiny corn tortillas or flat bread that will suffice.

This is as good as it gets. I went here with two of my best girlfriends for lunch before our shopping spree and fell in love with this place.  It's a perfect place for lunch with the family or even if you are on a date. The eating area is surrounded by plenty of trees(orange maybe?) I forgot for a second that I am in Arizona. Almost all of their food are locally grown and the produce are harvest on the same day....from their farm to your  plate.  I had grill salmon with asparagus and it was delicious, my friends had a BBQ hamburger(6 oz., thick cut bacon, blue cheese, hand-breaded onion ring, Joe's Real BBQ sauce.) and from the expressions on their faces it was DELISH. I recommend the zucchini fries, garlic fries and onion rings...it was a feature on food's network.  Enjoy :)

The food is great ! The service is great! Could always use more help but I think I got there during rush -dinner time.  Super cool bathrooms!  the tables could use some better cleaning- I always feel like the wet towel is just spreading the germs from one table to another  Will return to try the salmon next time .

I love love love this place and take out of town visitors here when I have the chance. It's usually about $10 for a burger which is average amongst restaurants but the food is delicious!  The onion rings in the burger is a great touch too. Great place to eat and hang out!
Overall I enjoyed the food and the outdoor setting.  While it fell a bit short of a 5 Star rating, I wouldn't hesitate to return.

A few negatives about this restaurant. First off, I ordered our food and drinks. Being this is my first time I assumed the drinks next to the check out were all they had so grabbed our waters and headed out to a picnic table...only to get chased down by the manager for not paying for our drinks! After crediting me back for the drinks he "thought" i was getting he had chased me down and humiliated me for 40 cents! Not a very good manager. Secondly, they sure do use a lot of throw aways, plastic and paper- not great for the environment. Food was OK, not great- lots of fried items, if that is healthy? I defiantly will not be going back or recommending them to my friends and family in the area, especially after their mistake ringing up our drinks- and then chasing me down for a measly 40 cents. And then to top it off, they don't recycle their glass bottles that he chased me down for the 40 cents- I had to bring home to recycle. WHAT?? SMH.
Great food, awesome environment. Everything is laid back and backyard seating so nothing too comfortable but the organic home grown food more than makes up for it.

I cannot say enough good things about this perfect restaurant. I love the ambiance, the FOOD (of course) and the fact that there is a farm right outside the restaurant that they grow veggies and other delights that they use in their cooking! Talk about farm to table!!   First off, this truly is a great summer restaurant to hit up, with it's beautiful outside seating around orange trees and other greenery. If there's a long line, no bother. You can walk 2 minutes away down to the farm and look at all their beautiful flowers, plants, and produce that they grow. GREAT place to let the kids run around.   Even when they are super busy, I feel like the line moves pretty quickly. They are very friendly and truly desire the highest quality for their food, which I admire so much.  Highlights from the menu: Salmon Salad (If you are a Salmon fan, this is for you) Farm Veggie Burger (LITERALLY the best one I've ever had, no lie) Any of the pizzas Any of the BBQ plates Garlic Fries (A MUST) Any of their shakes (they vary from season to season, all used with fresh ingredients from the farm!)   You really just have to go there and experience the greatness for yourself. If you love good food and enjoying the sunshine on a gorgeous day, this place is for you!

One of my three favorite onion rings!  The food tastes unusually fresh for burgers, pizzas and so forth, but they use local growers (many in their Agritopia subdivision).  The feel is very neighborly and is fun when you can sit outside and not fry.
Great vintage look to this restaurant.  Very tasty burgers that were well cooked and seasoned.  The peach milkshake was excellent!
Amazing experience, great food, fun atmosphere! Really kid friendly and feels like you are far from traditional dining experience in the suburbs!

This gem is only minutes away from our house and life is better for it! Whether you order in or to go, the food is usually prepared in a timely fashion and I haven't had a bad dish in 7 years. I recommend the bbq bacon Bleu Burger! I also recommend eating outside under the old tree!

Have heard about this place for years and finally tried it.  The ambiance is the best part.  However at night it is quite dark to sit outside on the picnic benches.  They really need more of the Christmas style lights.  Parking is abundant but packed.  The line was 24 minutes long on a Saturday night with only one employee taking orders.  Food was just okay.  Burger is very meaty tasting and thick.  The fries were cold fast eating outside so might have been better if I could have eaten faster.  My kid liked the pulled pork with sweet potato fries and coleslaw.  The drink choices are different.  Tasted all of them.  Went with the root beer first but it had a strange aftertaste.  Then tried the blood orange soda mixed with a bit of coconut soda.  That was way better.

We came on free burger day and only expected a free burger and thought they'd make us pay for anything else. They hooked us up! A delicious burger! Fries and a drink. This was awesome. We will definitely be back when in town again. They have their own garden and a huge beautiful shady outdoor sitting area. And they gave out free burgers for their 10th anniversary!

Overall one of the better casual family dining spots in the east valley, but the consistency of the dining experience has diminished over the past year. The food is always good and sometimes great. It used to be the other way around. Though the outdoor dining is nice, the grounds are looking like they need an overhaul. Prices have always been slightly high, but not outrageous.
Love this place. Super neat to sit outside and listen to the exotic birds they have. Food great and will go again!

Love this place! Can't wait to come back. The line gets crazy long. We arrived at 4:45 with no wait in line. By 5:00 the line was out the door! The portobello mushroom sandwich is delicious! The atmosphere is nice with lots of outdoor space to sit. Beautiful trees and surrounding farm. We will be back next time we come to the East valley.

Joes farm grill has always been one of my favorite places to go into, until recently. Don't get me wrong I will always love their breakfast tacos even though on occasion their potatoes are overcooked.  Their food is pretty good when it comes to flavor but lately I don't think it's worth the trouble of having to get our order right. I have had on numerous occasions gotten my order wrong.  Which isint a big deal if you eat there but when you take it to go, it's not something you wanna drive back for. They don't open your food when they give it to you to go so always make sure you check it yourself. Because it will save ya the drive and having your food half cold by the time you drive back home. Also today they told me they don't do "no ice" on drinks.  I ordered a lemonade and when I ordered the drink with no ice they didn't tell me anything about their policy. So when I got the drink, it had ice. I tried to get one without ice and they told me their manager tells their employees to put ice on their lemonades regardless if the customer asked for it otherwise. Had the lady told me at first I probably wouldn't have ordered it. With this order alone not only did they forget to tell me about their no ice policy but the girl over the phone forgot to add the extra side of beans I had ordered over the phone. I know we all make mistakes but it gets frustrating when it happens so often :/.  Anyhow long story short make sure your order is correct before you get it to go because from my experience I have decided to hardly ever go back to joes because of their inconsistencies.

I really wanted to dislike this place.  I thought for sure I'd hate it and think it was overrated.  I've driven by and seen the lines and laugh "I'm not waiting in a line like that for food."     So one day my daughter got out of school early, and we rushed to try it before the line starts. Which worked, only two families in front of us.  To start, the atmosphere was NOT my thing (note one star missing).  It reminded me of a concession stand at a zoo (flies and all).    But the food was sensational. I ordered the Blue Cheese and Bacon Burger, which was one the best burgers I've had in AZ.  My daughter ordered the chicken tenders, which were delicious (we always share a bite, just to compare).  We don't usually eat fries, but even their fries were good.  I also had the onion rings, which I've had better.   We will go back, and I will try one of their huge fresh salads that I saw others with.

I've got nothing bad to say about this place. Great staff, great service and wonderful cooked food. I've been here countless times and never had a bad experience. If I go though, I prefer for selection of hots dogs, two for $9.99.  But one is enough and will keep you longing for more. Can't wait to go back! Such a fun environment.

Great food, service is pretty fast! My family loves going here because of the outdoor patio. There are both indoor seating and outdoor with shade or in the sun! I love the sauce dispensers, where you can get your own ranch, mustard, ketchup ect! Also be sure to check out the bathrooms they're hilarious!

I've been waiting to cross the Farm Grill off my Yelp bucket list for a few years now! I'm over here in AZ visiting family so I finally had the chance to do just that  I had the Take Two foot long hot dog! It was great! I was told the dog was home made. It was top notch. I am the kinda guy who likes a dog to snap as you bite into it! The bun was great; tasted like it was home made and grilled.   My wife had the BBQ Chicken pizza. It was awesome. The bread used for the crust was definitely home made and had great texture.   The service was great! Very friendly staff! The place was super clean! We'll be back! I have two or three other items is like to try!

This place is just FUN!!!  Kids / Grandkids can run crazy in the open air eating area.  And your visit to the restroom will be equally as fun - hard to describe, just know you will enjoy a visit to the restroom!!   Great family heritage of the building and some fun menu items that you just don't find other places!  My grandchildren love the Green Eggs and Ham breakfast for obvious reasons!!  I love their burgers and Triple D made their chicken BBQ pizza famous!!  Great fun, great food!!  There may be a line at prime hours - but they move quick and worth the wait!!

Before they changed the menu this would have been five stars, but they recently got rid of the grilled peanut butter and banana split sandwich and that was one of our favorite things. We are heartbroken. My brother got the hot dogs instead and was very disappointed. He took one bite, said they taste "funky", and didn't want to eat anymore. So unless the sandwich is brought back I don't see us coming back any time soon.

I will say this...it was a commute to get there...but worth the drive. I love the whole concept of 'preserving agriculture' and growing all menu produce in the adjoining farm - and you can taste the difference - everything is fresh. While the decor was very lacking in its cafeteria style of service....the food made up for it - the burgers, the Ahi Tuna Sandwich....well I was 'IN" at the sweet potato fries. The portions are far from shy ....so bring your appetite!

Took my mom here for her birthday and we were not disappointed. This place is delicious and a wonderful concept. You wait in line order your food, which is exquisite, and then eat on the picnic benches outside. We loved it!

I love this place because everything is fresh and delicious. They really care about their customers and will do whatever it takes to make the customer happy!! I like the chicken sandwich and the salads!! I also buy the BBQ sauce b/c it doesn't have food coloring in it and it is delish!

Not only is Joe's a great concept restaurant to get a tasty meal, but it's also a great outing for the whole family.  A wonderful outdoor area with gardens in every direction on a working farm.   We are happy to make the trip from Tempe for this place!  Consistently a fantastic experience!
Awesome food and local. Sometimes a wait but worth it . My dad is buffalo chicken sandwich , homemade ketchup. Free birthday lunch,  great open space outside to eat
Best place ever! Love the coffee, the burgers, the farm ....just amazing....can't do wrong!!!!

Beautiful ambiance set up on a farm, food wasn't what I expected for the environment (greasy burgers and saucy chicken sandwiches) but still very good.  Not pretentious like other restaurants with the same style of set-up.  It's a bit pricey but the quality is good and you will definitely not leave here hungry.  It's very busy and loud but still a nice atmosphere.  Lots of waitstaff to clean up and help.  VERY clean for the size and how busy it is.  Fun little shops on the same property to walk around and look while your food settles.    Words of advice, if you like lemonade but not very sweet, order an extra cup to add water and mix.  The lemonade is delicious but very tart and way too much sugar for my taste.  I ended up getting a good 4 glasses out of my 1 drink.  Also, when certain items run out they don't post it.  I ordered twice and was told they were all out and had to settle on my 3rd choice.  Still very good though.
Very delicious burgers.  This felt like a nice little hidden gem out in Gilbert.  Beautiful location.

NOT Handicap friendly. Went here after seeing them on Channel 10 news and viewing their menu online. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I was very put off by management's lack of humane treatment toward the handicapped. After expected the handicapped to endure long lines STANDING outside in the hot sun, you would think management would at least offer a chair when asked if there was anything they could do for the handicapped. And not being 20 years old anymore, you would think they'd accommodate the aging category with a foot long hot dog that ISN'T loaded with the chili and cheese on it. (You can ask for it, but they charge you $10.99 for a hot dog, the same as the fully loaded one.)  And the outside dining area, which really brings in the farmhouse feel, isn't really wheelchair friendly, with several inch drops off the sidewalk to the picnic tables.  That's a shame because aging and handicapped individuals deserve the same opportunity to enjoy their nostalgic "food stand" goodies as much as the next guy. Nevertheless, I gave them two stars for their great food offerings, if you don't mind overpaying for items you can't eat or being in pain when you do finally get to sit down and eat them!
The Bomb, but what's up with those crazy lines..... The food is great 100%if the time
Very good food and an awesome place. It can be very busy but you can't blame them for that.
This place is always packed! Their burgers are amazing and is totally worth the wait at lunch time. The garlic fries are a great upgrade and their ranch is fantastic-- we love going here!!
Yum yum yum!! The Mediterranean scramble and the imperial omelette were INCREDIBLE!! This place is amazing every single time I go and the staff is so helpful!!!

I have been going here for quite some time and to be honest the reason that I am moved to Arizona. I went for a walk after lunch in the garden and walked into Agritopia looking at houses in the area and fell in love.  The food is awesome. The ambience is casual. There is nothing like it in Gilbert.

Burgers, chicken and sides are all fantastic. Farm fresh produce. Good quality meats.  This is one of the most fun restaurants to eat at. Sit outside under a pine tree at a picnic table.  The perfect place to bring out-of-town guests for a great meal, and memorable experience. Highly recommended.

We ate here this past weekend while visiting Phoenix.  We enjoyed the food very much.  I ordered the Ahi Tuna Sandwich with garlic fries, my wife ordered the Chicken Pesto sandwich with onion rings and a chocolate malt, my mother and stepfather ordered burgers with sweet potato fries and fried zuchini and my 2 1/2 yer old got a kid's cheese pizza.  Everything was really good.  We all tried some of each of the sides.  Everyone loved the garlic fries.  The onion rings were very good.  My wife and mother liked the sweet potato fries. The pizza had really fresh sauce and the crust was quite good.  My wife's chocolate malt was the best we have had in a while.  The food was all very fresh and quite tasty.  We will definitely eat here again when we are in Phoenix.

Vegan and vegetarian friendly On top of that,  the vegetarian burger is THE BEST I've ever had in my years of being a vegetarian.  I couldn't stop eating.  It's made with vegan 1000 island dressing as well.  The owner stopped by to visit us during ite lunch and she was so sweet.  Only dropped 1  because the iced tea is instant,  not fresh brewed :( it was pretty gross.  I dumped it out immediately and got water instead.
I love this place. The food, the location, the backstory of how it came to be. Fontina Burger!

I think this place might be a little too hyped on Yelp. It's not the culinary extravaganza I thought it would be.  Basically, Joe's is a counter-order diner with fresh food. I thought the menu items were pretty basic, and portions were rather small for the diner-restaurant category. The food quality is good, don't get me wrong, and the place is pretty cute. The bathroom is awesome.   But overall, I'd say this falls into the very good, but not OMG amazing ranking.

Delicious food made from local fresh ingredients and a beautiful park like setting with ample seating. Don't be deterred by the long line to order, it moves quickly and doesn't take long to receive your food.

love this place. I discovered it b/c it's next to cosmo  dog park. This place is an oases in the center of the desert if you like to get that country feeling with greenery, trees and chirping birds. The food is awesome. The burgers are amazing.  The weekends are crowded so if you can go during the week, it's much more relaxing. Wish i can live in this development called Agritopia which is attached to the farm. Lovely farm feeling. Love it!

I had to experience it since everyone was raving about it.  Not sure what the hype was about, I had the tuna and it was tasteless, but I loved my garlic fries.  I'm not sure but I pictured it as a sit down and a server comes over restaurant, not a fast food joint.  Everyone else in my party liked their food, but didn't think it was the greatest thing ever.  Don't believe the hype.  If it wasn't on Diner's, Drive-Ins, and Dives, it wouldn't of been as successful.

I was hesitant about coming here. I just wanted a margarita and some sub-par food to absorb the tequila. Finding out that I was being taken to some fast-casual burger place without alcohol was slightly disappointing to me. I sucked it up and went on Yelp to see what's good here, and imagine my surprise to see over 700 reviews with an average of 4 stars. Suddenly, the afternoon started to look up.  Based on Yelp reviews, I ordered the Fontina Burger with garlic fries, my friends ordered The Farm Burger and BBQ Bleu Cheese Pizza, and together we shared the Butter Pecan Shake.  The first bite of my burger made me forget all about cool refreshing margarita waiting for me at some hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. My burger was better than alcohol --- fuck that noise. This is clearly going to earn my five stars.  After I embarrassed my friends by moaning out loud while eating my burger I was actually stoked about my garlic fries. Imagine my surprise to find out that I hated them. I hated the garlic fries. I love garlic, I love fries, but I HATED these garlic fries. Actually, I hated them so much I forgot how much I loved my burger. They were just so pungent and strong and overwhelming. I was eating raw garlic on soggy, oily fries. Eck, just remembering it makes me queasy.   I had a five star burger and a 1 star side of fries, that unfortunately averages out to 3 stars. However, my friends raved about their food so I'm bumping up to four and calling it a night. A good margarita will surely erase the taste of garlic fries from my person.

i read their menu and decided it was too simple for me to try.  then my husband said he wanted to go so on we went, and boy i was surprised.  yes it's simple; burgers/dogs/milkshakes/fries.....but they do it WELL!  the fries are some of the best i have ever had...they taste sooo fresh.   pretty cool building too, and a lot of outdoor seating.

The food is so fresh and you can tell the employees take pride in their job. If you want a nice day to take a walk around the farm as well as eat one, this is the place! The pizza is delicious and don't forget to get one of their seasonal shakes. Not to mention the fried zucchini is amazing! Get there early and avoid noon since the line does grow fast.

One of my partners lives in Agritopia with his wife.  It's a nice community, and we just happened to be visiting. He felt bad that we had such a bad experience at Joe's Real BBQ that he wanted to buy us dinner to redeem his dreadful recommendation.   Therefore, he and his wife take us to another one of his Gilbert Faves - Joe's Farm Grill.  He talked up a storm about this place, and he also mentioned that this place was featured in the Food Network show entitled Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  This would have probably been a big deal to me, if I had actually seen this show. Seeing as that I barely watch TV, I really wasn't that overly impressed.   That quickly changed when we got to Joe's Farm Grill, which was just around the corner.  As we pulled up, both my wife and I just marveled at the exterior. It was such a throwback to a  past era, and it was quite inviting. Definitely very "urban farm-like" and fits right in with the overall surrounding neighborhoods.  I just wanted to hang out, and this time around we weren't really that hungry. So, we opted for a light fare. I chose the Salmon Combo, and my wife had the Hotdog. Nothing too fancy so that we could spend more time talking, rather than obsessing about the food quality.  My wife really enjoyed her Hotdog. Not sure what was in it, but she had nothing but good things to say about it. My Salmon was just marginal. Probably more hype, than actual flavor.   However, the surroundings, the atmosphere, the company, and the other friendly customers made up for whatever was lacking in my particular food selection. This time around, we chatted up a storm with just about everyone around us.   We stayed longer than we normally would have, but it was definitely a fun and memorable time discovering this Gilbert treasure!
Modern convenience meets mommas cooking. Burgers are hard to pass up, but there are several other menu items that are awesome. Chicken fingers for one. Try the garlic fries if you dare.
There is a reason this place is packed, something for everyone. Can grab a quick meal or spend an hour enjoying the atmosphere.
Love the Food, the Chicken Sandwich was very good and the sides are amazing! The Line is always long I wish they would open the 2nd register at night and on Sundays

I don't know why everybody is so crazy about this place. Wait time is long and food is mediocre. You can't really screw up a burger, so that's okay. But the other sandwiches, like the ahi sandwich or portabello sandwich sound great, but are mediocre at best. Preparation was lacking--probably needed a hotter grill. Crowded, slow, mediocre food...no desire to return. Oh, and overpriced.

I was contacted by the manger at this location cause of my bad review, I am really for proactive owners. I really need to go back to this location to give them another try since the first time I went there it was really good. I was given a gift card to wipe out what I paid for the last meal as kinda of do over. I will be back Anthony and I will let you know how my next visit is.

Little overrated in my opinion. The salmon had no flavor at all. The garlic sauce that came with it was good. The baked potatoes fries weren't anything special. Milk shake machine was broke when we went to. I'd give it one more chance but not anytime soon.
