It is a ton of ahi, served rare with a great wasbi mayo and slaw. It was one of the better sandwiches I've had in a long time.  Also, I'd highly recommend the onion rings, they are a must. After lunch we walked over to the coffee shop for a cupcake. The baker there was on cupcake wars and they lived up to the hype. The red velvet cupcake was the best I've ever had.  They were the type of thing you would order a dozen of, sit in a room by yourself and eat them all without telling anyone.

I like Joe's Farm Grill and it seems to be the place where our family tends to always meet since the kids can run around and be noisy. But I find it's a tad bit pricy for the food. I also think the food is too greasy and I haven't found a salad that I love. My husband loves Joe's Farm Grill, he's a burger lover, so he is a big fan. I love the onion rings but couldn't eat there all the time. It's a nice treat. eating there on my birthday is fun because you get a free meal. I just think it's over priced. My kids don't like their food either.
Unbelievably good. Worth the trip.

My husband and I have wanted to check out Joe's Farm Grill for a while. We have friends who live in Agritopia, and have mentioned Joe's to us. Each time we've wanted to stop, the parking lot was overflowing, and so we didn't stop.  We finally made it to Joe's on a Sunday morning. Joe's is located amongst other buildings, and is a little difficult to locate. When we finally found it, we walked in, and there was a server at the door to greet us, he was pleasant, when we explained it was our first time in, he took the time to explain how the process worked. They have plastic menus by the door, and also an electronic menu by the ordering counter. When you make your way up to the counter, you can select a beverage from a cooler by the counter, there is juice, Naked smoothies, and bottled water. They also offer coffee, and fountain beverages. After reviewing the menu, I decided on the breakfast tacos. 3 corn tortillas filled with eggs, and they give you your choice of bacon, sausage, or chicken. There is a green sauce and sour cream. The tacos are served with a side of farmer beans, I also chose an orange juice.  After placing our orders, we found a table, and a very short time later our food arrived. The tacos and beans looked appealing, but the taste was not. I felt the tacos lacked flavor, as well as the farmer beans, the orange juice was fresh squeezed and delicious.  Joe's prides themselves on using local, organic produce and cage-free eggs which is great, but in my opinion the breakfast needs more flavor.  I loved the décor. The inside was large, clean and bright. There are picnic tables for family style dining outside if you choose.  I am not letting my bland breakfast experience deter me from Joe's, as both my husband and I agreed to go back and try something from their lunch menu.

One day, about three years ago, I wanted some fries. I wanted them badly. After a while on the internet I found that Joe's Farm Grill supposedly had the best fries in town, so I went, expecting nothing more than some good fries. What I got, was an almost religious experience. I am now a convert to whatever this Joe guy is selling.    Joe's Farm Grill is so grand, in fact, that I find it kind of hard to review. A delicious, locally owned restaurant that was featured on Food Network attached to a beautiful farm where they grow their vegetables, plus an award winning cupcake/coffee shop and some of the coolest bathrooms I've ever seen. I could write three pages on it! But I'll make it simple, because there are plenty other reviews to look through. I have never had anything less than great here, whether you're looking for a burger and fries or some ahi tuna, Joes is here for you like a charismatic cult leader. If you haven't stopped by Joes, punch yourself in the face, then head on out.

Definitely not what I expected. Slow service and all our food came out cold. We asked if we could get it fresh and hot and it took 10 more minutes and it was lukewarm. Awesome. Will not be back. Too expensive for average food served cold. I couldn't recommend it to anyone. I think the high reviews are solely from hype alone. Oh well. Now I know.

We love their food! Locally owned and operated, locally grown, this is a win for all, and we fully support them. Must try is the grilled bbq pizza, it's their signature. The sauce has the perfect sweet flavor and compliments the onion. The shredded chicken is not dried out either.  I have to say though, my favorite item on their menu is simple- the grilled cheese sandwich. Best grilled cheese I've ever had. Perfect blend of cheeses with a perfect amount, which compliments the bread. If you are a fan of grilled cheese it's worth driving from anywhere to have Joe's version.  Be sure to try their beet salad as well. Who would have thought beets would be make perfect salad.

The atmosphere is definitely cool, you have to go to the bathroom here- no joke!  It is usually pretty busy and the food is expensive, but it's always worth a visit.  The food is fresh (the reason it's more expensive I believe).  I have had the BBQ pizza which I thought was so-so, farm chicken sandwich, pecan shake (seasonal and amazing), the fried fish, love all of their variations on fries and had a hot dog one time that was pretty good too.  Overall I think the food is pretty good!

Awesome products! I have tried over 9 different items from there menu so far and all I can say everything was delicious but my favorite of all is Ahi tuna witch  is the best grilled tuna sandwich I have ever had period !

This place is great. As you enter you feel like you went back in time. The menu has so many options. The staff is always friendly and the food is really good. It is my son's favorite burger place and that says a lot because he loves his burgers.
I love the Fontina Burger. Best hamburger ever
Decent food. Not wordly good but it's ok. Kind of overpriced. The place has a lot of character and it's pretty unique.

My new favorite food joint! The food tastes so fresh and flavorful. I love this spot for a burger, salad, chicken sandwiches or lemonades. The place is clean , the wait wasn't that long for food and the service was amazing. With my boyfriend and I the total came out to around 30 bucks , but it was really worth cost. I can't wait to return. We walked around the Garden after our meal, the view is beautiful.

I got lucky because the Lamb Burger was a special. It was absolutely the best burger I have ever had in my entire life. The meat was tender and seasoned perfectly, but unlike a regular hamburger it had a lightness and savoriness that was unique. I had the side caesar salad which was just lathered with delicious caesar dressing. A bit too much dressing for me but still tasty. I also tried the garlic fries which smelled amazing and tasted even better. I do NOT eat onion rings, but I couldn't resist trying theirs and boy, they were awesome. Finally, my boyfriend had the Ahi Tuna Sandwich which was worth the trip on it's own. Take the drive...it's well worth it!

Pros: good burgers, shakes and fries -- really good!  Cons: overcooked ahi tuna (was chewy), average onion rings; burgers/sandwiches hastily assembled and hard to eat.  Stick with the burgers, fries and shakes, very disappointed in rest.  I want to try pizza next though.

Do yourself a favor and come here as many times as humanly possible.   The vibe of the place is great- super cute and has a kind of farmers market feel to it. Like a community spot- which I love!   We just barely made it in for breakfast at 10:56 (ends at 11) and I am so happy we did! I went with my bestie and she ordered two pancakes (omg so fluffy) bacon and eggs. I ordered the green eggs and ham and added mushrooms.   Green eggs and ham is everything I want in a meal. Scrambled eggs with cheese, ham, and PESTO. Honestly any chance to eat pesto and I take it.   Cooked perfect. Extremely flavorful. Wishing I didn't live an hour and fifteen minutes away from it.

Cafeteria-style dining, farm to table ingredients, and fancy organic sodas on tap! This place was driving 49 min to Gilbert. You must try one of the fried sides. They are seasoned and come with house made ranch dressing that is excellent. Super family (and dog) friendly place.

We drove an hour. We waited in the 50 person line. Our mouths watered.   Owned by the same people as Joe's BBQ, this place was great with awesome selections! No one in my family complained about their meal, which is ever so rare. Joe's Farm Grill offers selections for breakfast, then the rest of the day offers burgers, sandwiches, pizza, ribs, lots of sides, salads, and more! What else can you ask for? All of the items seemed to be of high quality and extremely tasty!  The environment of the place is great. It feels as if you are in a mix of a place is disneyland thrown in the midwest. You just have to be there to understand. There were more seating inside than out, which is awesome during the winter. I can see this being a bit iffy during the summer though. You walk up in a line to order your food, then wait around 10 minutes for it to be made.  For food, I personally opted for BBQ Ribs with a Side Caesar, Fries, Garlic Flatbread, and a Peppermint Shake at around 25 dollars. This was as expensive as it gets. The burgers and salads were around 8 dollars each. The ribs were fall off the bone and very messy, but oh so worth it!  Overall, Joe's Farm Grill is a must for anyone to try! Now, what are you doing reading the end of this review? Leave your place of residence. Get in your car. And go to Joe's Farm Grill. NOW!
The BBQ was excellent. My wife had a the Gouda burger which was awesome. BBQ ribs were good. Would highly recommend trying this place out.

Joe's has been hit and miss over the last year for me. Some days they knock it out of the park with some of the food. Then the next time its average and there is a problem. So it gets 3 stars instead of a solid 4.  It does get crowded at the typical feeding hours, especially weekends. Plan ahead as the wait for food can be over 45 minutes.  Problems I've had, filled wrong order for to go, got home and found it was wrong and overcharged for what I did get. It was resolved by manager on the phone but still frustrating.  Another time my food sat for 20 minutes before they got around to paging me. Very frustrating. The flies have returned, I eat inside and am still constantly brushing them away from my food, I just cover food with a napkin until I get to it.  Some staff are wearing shirts with anti fly logos, but they don't seem to be doing much fly eradicating.  Address the fly issue. I worked on a horse farm and there are ways to discreetly address fly issues.   Good things: the fried zucchini and onion rings are great.  The Chicken Farm salad is great when they get it right. However I've noticed the chicken serving seems to have gotten smaller. The beets are a good addition to the other veggies in the salad.  Milk shakes are good too, they do offer special flavors often.
Love this place! It's the perfect setting for wiggly kids but you still get FABULOUS food. You cant beat that!
Fun place to take guests.  Different menu.  The fried shrimp is to die for.  Highly recommend.

This place is awful and a Greece pit. There hamburgers used to be great and now they have no flavor. Fries were cold. Kids meals was also cold..  a waste of money and had to eat elsewhere. We through our food away after a couple of bites

We are new to the Gilbert area and have been hearing great reviews about Joe's plus its right down the street from our house. We took our daughter one afternoon after school. My daughter had a chicken sandwich, the boyfriend had a bacon cheeseburger and we shared a BBQ chicken pizza. Everything was decent, if not a little pricey. We also bought a strawberry lemonade which my boyfriend said was way too sour. A nice experience but not one I see us repeating often due to the price.

Two of us spent $33 for dinner and we got a hamburger and a fish special. The food was only mediocre. It turns out that the hamburger is cooked to rare. Apparently the menu says that but I didn't see it. The hamburger was red and slimy inside. I can't imagine how it passed the Health Department regulations for temperature. The fried Zucchini was not crisp. The shrimp were actually too big and just uninspired.  The fries were not tasty. I like the McDonalds or Burger King fries a lot better. Having said the above, we did like the cod and the cole slaw. Needless to say we were unimpressed and will not be back.

I went here for my daughters birthday and her meal was on the house! I got the sweet pork BBQ sandwich with sweet potato fries...amazing! I like the feel and culture here. It is a great famiky enviornment with seating and play areas outside. I recommend this place for sure.

This was my go to spot in Gilbert for a fresh burger or thin crust pizza but now I even love Joe's for breakfast! Their motto "common food done uncommonly well" could not be truer! Some of my favorites are the BBQ Bacon Blue Burger, the BBQ Chicken Pizza, and the egg & potato breakfast tacos. All 3 are out of this world! My fiance and I have eaten at Joe's more times than I can count and each time the food has been fresh and fantastic. We have never been disappointed!

The best place for a salad, burger, breakfast around! There's a reason it's on Food Network...it's AMAZING!  The staff are friendly and very accommodating, the food is incredible. The sweet potato fries with the pineapple dipping sauce is out of this world! Not to mention the portabello mushroom salad and sandwich, Ahi sandwich, etc. Besides that, it's on a farm area, so the kids can run around in nature (where they get their vegetables) so it's such a great environment!

Well that was interesting. I had heard so much about this place, my parents were in town, like to try new and local so here we go.   It is a walk-up window order system. Got there around 6 and the line was clear out the door. It took a really long time to get to the front because they just had one window open.   53 minutes later and a free milkshake later we get our food. Something got screwed up with our order. Ughhhhh. Why me...?  Finally we eat. The fontina burger was delicious. Beet salad yummy. Sweet potato fries were average. Garlic fries, deelish.   Oh and there are kids running around everywhere. Screaming and crying. Everywhere.   So overall, food good... atmosphere and wait, not so much.
Great food! Try the new things. Whatever it is, try it. Never a let down! It's awesome that it's close to us too but would drive a distance fir this place

Food is great. I love their outdoor seating. It's a refreshing atmosphere. The food is a little bit on the pricier end, BUT it's fresh and the quality gets two thumbs up. It's a popular place, so don't be surprised to find the line out the door.

if this is your first time order from the items highlighted on the menu.  I was in PHX for one night and went based on yelp reviews.  My father and I ordered from the featured items (to DIE for Ahi Tuna sandwich and sweetpotato fries for me) and the others in our party did not.  We were munching away totally happy not to be eating at yet another identikit chain joint while they miserably played with their food.

The food is always delicious here! I've gone for breakfast, lunch and dinner and never been disappointed. The pancakes are honestly the tastiest pancakes I've ever had. Another great thing about this place is if you go on your birthday you get a $10 credit to spend on a meal. Def recommend!!
Such a great place to visit. The food is slightly above average but the ambiance is so unique and quaint. It's a great place to bring visitors... and the coffee shop is amazing.

Take a freaking cool A environment with sweet trees and citrus growing all over the place on a beautiful piece of real estate, and then add in abnormally delicious food with a really unique flair to it and you have JOE'S Farm Grill.   I would go there even if their food was mediocre because of the cool atmosphere that the "farm" provides, but the food is like the cherry on top! Do yourself a huge favor and order the garlic fries. Make sure you don't have any hot dates lined up for about a week or so because the effects are long lasting, but it's worth it for an occasional guilty pleasure.  **UPDATE:   You can't go wrong with whatever you order. I've had multiple burgers, sandwiches, the Sonoran Dog, Carolina Dog, ahi tuna sandwich, the BBQ sampler plate, and they're ALL ridiculously good.

Haven't had a bad experience yet!  The line can get long, but that's a sign that they are doing well.  The line was the longest part.  Once we ordered, it took less than 10 minutes to get our food.  So from getting in line to getting our food was 40 minutes.  Not bad for a Saturday evening dinner.  The onion rings are out of this world.  Crispy, flavorful, and the onion actually stays inside the ring when you take a bite out of it.  Definitely a family favorite!  Highly recommend.

Unique place, very affordable.  No beer, which is a bummer.  The pulled pork sandwich was very tasty.  However, can't give it any more than 3 stars because it gave me food poisoning.  I think it was just a fluke...but still.

Okay...time to update my review.  If you haven't visited Joe's Farm Grill, you're missing out.  The concept is great.  A family farm turned into a touristy farm-to-table restaurant.  The family turned the house they grew up in into a restaurant and it's still surrounded by a wonderful vegetable and fruit garden.  They have also added so many other amazing things to the property, such as a winery, a coffee shop, a craft brewery...but I will review those separately.  My point is that a visit to Joe's isn't just about the food...it's an experience.  BUT, of course, I'm going to review the food as well.  The concept is fresh food.  I believe their original concept was to use everything they produced, but as they have expanded, they have reached out to other local producers.  I had been here on a few other occasions, ordering various menu items, but was never quite wowed.  That is until my birthday this year.  You see, they offer you a free meal on your birthday up to a $10 value so I had my kids take me here.  As we waited in line, we reviewed the menu trying to decide what to order.  A short time later, a woman walked out of the kitchen to let everyone know the specials of the day.  She pointed out that the specials were also on the screens at the front of the line, but from the way she described them, we were sold.  We went with the Gouda Garlic Bacon Burger and OMG...one of my top five burgers ever! We also got the garlic fries and I probably wouldn't order them again because they were way too garlicky but that's just a taste preference.  But oh that burger!!  The service was also exceptional.  The cashier wished me a Happy Birthday, of course, since I was there for my free meal.  He also asked if we had the burger before and when we said we hadn't, he let us know that it was one of his favorites.  I can see why!  I already mentioned the woman who came out to tell us about the specials.  Well, as we were enjoying our meal, she was walking around from table to table to make sure everyone was enjoying their meal. Such great customer service!  I really have no complaints and urge everyone to check it out when in the area.  I really don't think you'll be disappointed.

Took my 9 year old there on Saturday...super packed with hungry people.  Service was good, line was long, waited in line for 20 minutes.  Food was plentiful and tasty... American burgers and fries.  The drinks were a little funky tasting but refreshing.  We would go back.
Cant go wrong with the 4B burger or the killer Ahi tuna sandwich . I take all my friends and family here when they come out from Santa Barbara.

Love love love this place. Have an incredible selection of fresh food. You definitely won't find any frozen fries being thrown into a fryer here. everything is made from scratch and worth the short wait. I love sitting outside when the weather is good. You will want to keep coming back here!
We had a tour here and the manager Clayton was awesome! The food was great and the customer service was excellent. I had the pork tenderloin sandwich.

I'm not one to sit up on a pedestal and tell you to eat organic.  Honestly, I don't care if there were some high powered fertilizers used to grow my tomatoes if they're fresh.  And that's exactly what you'll get here - fresh.  They harvest their veggies from the large garden out back which you're free to walk through before or after your meal.  The food is varied and there is something for everyone.  The salads are large, the sandwiches are filling, and the sides are all very good.  The only downside of Joe's is the price.  You'll probably be looking at $30 for lunch for 2 especially if you choose to have dessert or a shake (you should have a shake).  All told it is a fantastic lunch option and a great place to take out-of-town visitors, especially in the cooler months!

Joe's Farm Grill is a fun and family centric place to eat. It's got great options and produces high quality food that tastes like you're paying for a 5-star meal. They have a fun outside patio that shaded by large trees and overshadows an actual farm, located just next door. Joe's Farm Grill is a great option for delicious food, a great atmosphere, and great philosophy on both food service and the community.
Overated. Food basic because "farm fresh." Service lacking. Patio is dirty and chaotic

Great place to have a hearty breakfast. So many great options but my favorite in common go to, is Joe's big breakfast.  Their strawberry lemonade is my absolute favorite and will order that with any meal.    The best thing about this place, beside the food, is the outdoor seating. Very kid and pet friendly.

I depend on Yelp both locally and as I travel. The ratings are usually close to what I'd give them. Over the years, Yelp's penetration in Europe has grown -- which is making a more important tool for me. On my first trip to Copenhagen, I found a great little Italian restaurant that I'd never found without Yelp. Now, the hotel concierge has it on their list.
We always have great food anytime we are here !  I can't believe I haven't written a review yet !  Expect to wait to order and for your food but... it totally worth every second !

Great food excellent service!! I frequent this place regularly with my wife and kids. We are able to ride bikes over to it and enjoy dinner or breakfast on the large patio out back and take our bikes over to our table!!!!   Ahi Tuna sandwich is amazing along  with Joe's Big Breakfast for the early rides...
Love this place - the local atmosphere and the set up is awesome. Such a great gem right here in GILBERT!

This place is AWESOME!!! I ordered the BBQ pork plate the portion was HUGE, I couldn't finish it all!!! It was so delicious. Pricing is extremely fair!!! I love the seating area outside, its like having a picknick!!!

I had heard about this restaurant from several different sources and all recommended it.  First, let me say it isn't easy to find if you are unfamiliar with the area. However, once you locate it, it is worth it.  Being from the Midwest and growing up on breaded pork tenderloins, my friend and I decided we would try the pork tenderloins at Joe's. Wow! This is the best I've had outside of Iowa.  The size was not for the faint-hearted. As a side, my friend ordered the onion rings and I ordered the fried green beans. Both were very good, but be forewarned,- you have to really like garlic (which I do) if you get the fried green beans.  There are so many other good-sounding items on the menu that we will be coming back for sure.

It's ok. Reminds me of a cafeteria. The food is just ok. Not great. You have to wait in line for food then find a place to sit and then get your food   The prices are a bit high.   Check it out for yourselves but do go in with high expectations.

Amazing food and hang.   We went at 11:30am and there was a wait BUT ITS WORTH IT!   My buddy got the lamb burger and was in heaven. I got the salad and it beats every other salad you can get. Tons of veggies in it: beets, bell peppers, corn, + more. Fries were standard and good. Tried my friends fried zucchini, very good.  Cheesecake very good.  And the owner or manager working was more than helpful and kind. Her name is Summer. She made sure we had everything we needed.   And man, eating outside in the beautiful weather in the shade just topped it off perfectly!
Great food. Terrible fly problem. Outside is a constant swarm, inside is 2 or 3 per table.  GROSS!

Once again come on Guy you must be eating different food then they serve me... I have given Joe's farm grill two try's now and not impressed with the long lines to everything there... Frist visit ordered the same meal guy did Ahi Tuna Sandwich (Grilled rare, wasabi mayo Asian slaw with fries I also bought a order of onions rings... Well I was waiting I was so lucky to watch a loop of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives of Joes's Farm Grill on tvs they have there... My number is called and I get my food from the window the ahi is not rare at all so over cooked the oinion rings are so greasy and are not good this guy bummed... Second trip I have to wait 20 people deep out the door for lunch I order the BBQ Bacon Blue Burger (6oz, thick cut apple wood smoked bacon, blue cheese, hand breaded onion rings and Joe's real BBQ sauce... Once again it was not this meal that I was hoping for it was just ok really greasy and filling not my kind of meal... I will go back one more time in hopes that the 3rd will be the charm.

I came here for Father's Day with my family and my cousins family. It was spectacular. We ordered a feast of food that range from rib sandwiches onion rings samplers you name it. Only thing that bugged me was eating outside because there were so many flies, other than that everything was cooked to perfection and I love coming back to this place
Very cool place with great food! Just wish parents knew how to control their children so others can enjoy their meal. This is a restaurant not the city park.
Would leave them 0 stars if I could. Put in a 7 person order and they did not bring me my meal. This place sucks.

A LOT of hype surrounding this place because of Triple D (the Show on Food Network)  Anyway, been here for breakfast and lunch and always looking forward to coming back.  This morning all the normal breakfast foods were loved.  My kids love this place and are always happy with breakfast.   I love the pulled pork sandwich & ribs and everything else I have ever had here.  Truly a great place.  I have not tried the pastrami and some of the other stuff that has made this place famous, but I will eventually get to it.    This place has a really great environment too - good for kids.  They do have seats inside if you are wondering.  You do not have to sit outside if there are open tables inside.  Every time I have gone there has been places to sit inside.   Go try it if you have been thinking about it.  Really great food and great service.

I love this place. It's a great place to bring your kids and let them run around while you enjoy watching them and chatting with whomever you are eating with. It's very casual and the food is great. I've really only had one bad experience, but I've been here so many times with great experiences that I can't hold it against them. I definitely recommend it if you have kids. Not so much for a date or anything like that.

Boy is this place popular,,,when i drove up,i thought there was some sort of event happening looking at the long line. I persevered the wait and the environment was well worth it. With the right kind of weather its as cool a place as you can hope for. It has a huge tree that provides it great character. Folks with their pets and some with their exotic birds provide a great add on. The food was good,although i found everything from the ribs and the shake to be a little too sweet. Still i will reiterate the ambiance will keep bringing me back here. I understand its a family place,but addition of a beer option in the outdoor setting would be a super addition
Great eats.  A little something for everyone.  Nice service and decent prices.  We try to visit regularly.

A friend took me here for our weekly lunch and it was a really cool dining experience.  It's very no fuss, it's set up like a fast food place, you look at the menu on the wall then order from the person behind the window.  Then they give you a buzzer that will go off when your food is ready while you go pick a place outside to eat.  The food is amazing!  You can tell how fresh everything is and it's cooked great too.  I can't wait to go back and get another great burger!

Yum! This place has great burgers and the sweet potato fries are excellent. They have all kinds of organic options which is awesome and it has a nice little outside area that is great for families and good people watching. It's in a fairly secluded and quiet area also.  You pay a little bit more for the organic foods that they raise there, but I think it's worth it. Definitely a destination in the easy valley that's worth driving to. One way to save money is to share the order of fries since they're pretty big.
Amazing! Delicious! Friendly!  The owner Joe,  I just love him.  He is a humble Christian man. Thanks you Joe.

These guys deliver EVERY time.  Such great, respectful service, fun environment and fantastic food.  The menu has so much variety and something for everyone.  Appreciate their commitment to excellence.  Can't say enough good things about Joe's.
Great food! Friendly staff. Always packed so go early!! I love good breakfast so keep it up y'all :-)

I had heard all the hype and read all the awesome Yelp reviews of this place so I decided to try it out for my birthday. It's pretty awesome how they give you a $10 credit toward your meal (must be on your actual birthday). I ordered the Fontina burger which includes bell pepper, mushroom, and fontina cheese. Upon first bite, I could immediately tell the difference from other establishments in terms of freshness and taste. Normally bland lettuce actually had a fresh taste and crunch to it! The cheese brought me back to my trip to Italy in terms of quality! It really does make a difference when you use locally grown ingredients. For dessert I ordered the German Chocolate Shake which was downright heavenly as well.  NOTE to Vegans: Don't let the meat pics steer you away -- they have vegan options too!  My family is coming out to visit in about a week and I cannot wait to introduce them to Joe's Farm Grill!

One of my favorite restaurants.  The food is great!  One of my favorites is the Farm Burger.  The most amazingly fresh greens!  This is a great place to bring the family.  After dinner, my kids love to run around and play with the other kids around and the parents can have time to hang out.  Don't forget!  You've gotta come here on your birthday!  They'll knock off $10 from your bill to say Happy Birthday!  Awesome place!  You'll love it!

Who doesn't love Joe's? It goes without saying that this place is great. Their garlic fries put Gilroy to shame, the onion rings are devilish, all of their shakes are top-notch. Then there's the beet salad and grilled veggie pizza...I could go on forever.   This quaint farm house turned restaurant really has it figured out.   And I always go next door to the Coffee Shop for an after-lunch/dinner latte.

Highly recommended. Fontina burger is amazing! Along with sweet potato fries and vanilla bean shake. High quality food with delicious ingredients. There is tons of outdoor picnic tables to enjoy the AZ sunshine. If the line is long don't worry it goes fast and short wait time for your food too!

Delicious food!  The garlic fries and shakes are the best!  I love their banana pudding shake!  Their pesto chicken sandwich and chicken caesar salad are delicious.  The wait can be long.  I recommend ordering by phone and picking up at the pickup window during busy times.  You have to pay by credit card in advance but you can bypass the wait and still eat there if you want.
Excellent food and service.  Priced right.  I go there every chance I get, especially on my birthday.
Delicious Farm Veggie Burger, and my husband raved about his BBQ Pork. The lemonade was to die for as well. We'll be back!

Ate here for the first time a couple weeks ago when I had family visiting. I was really looking forward to breakfast as their waffles looked so good but we got there 10 mins too late. We stayed and got lunch instead, it was really good! I got the chicken strips and fried zucchini. So good! We can't wait to go back and try their breakfast. Loved the outdoor seating. And the employees were all really friendly. There was an elderly woman there with a service dog and I was very impressed with how attentive and caring they all were with her. Will definitely start coming more regularly!

Just before the new year my husband and I took my dad to Joe's.  My dad is a big fan of triple D so Joe's was the perfect place.  The line was really short and just as we were ordering, we noticed all of a sudden the line was about 20 people deep.    We ordered EVERYTHING!  I got the burger w/ cheese and sweet potato fries.  My husband got the chicken BBQ pizza, dad got the ahi tuna sandwich w/ sweet potato fries.  Of course we just had to get an order of onion rings (featured on triple D show) and two vanilla milk shakes.  I have to say that hands down my favorite thing was the BBQ pizza.  It has the perfect balance of chicken, bacon, blue cheese crumbles all drizzled with Joe's BBQ sauce...mmm the best.  I would also say that the sweet potato fries are worth the upgrade price and I didn't leave a single one on my plate...sweet, salty and no too crunchy.  Seating is limited when its cold outside so I recommend beating the dinner rush like us.

Quintessential Gilbert. Thank you Joe!  Fram Grill serves fantastic meals in a cozy space suited for both indoor or outdoor seating. Regardless of party size, the Farm Grill can accommodate you! There awesome picnic tables scattered outside, many of them situated under large shade trees to keep you out of that AZ sun. If air conditioning is your thing, then there are plenty of indoor seats that provide a much cooler climate during the summer daze.  If you've dined at one of Joe's other restaurants you know the food will be good. All ingredients are sourced locally, and many of the veggies are farmed right behind the shop in Agrotopia farms. You can walk over after your meal to watch them harvest the greens, spices, veggies, etc. And let me tell you, when you are biting into that freshly grilled hamburger you can taste how fresh those onions and leaf lettuce is! It's awesome. The salads are massive in size and super fresh. There's a couple of BBQ items that are delicious too.   Drink options are fun. The organic brand Tractor Soda is served here and they offer fun and unique carbonated flavors such as Cola, Root Beer, Ginger Beer, Cherry Cream, Coconut, Blood Orange, Lemon Grass, Meyer Lemon and Cucumber. They are awesome!! (You can also grab a traditional canned soda if you're not feeling adventurous).   Breakfast is served here as well, and there's a great kids menu for both breakfast and lunch. Joe has really built up this corner of Gilbert- there's an awesome coffee shop steps away from the Farm Grill if you'd like a nice espresso after your meal. Grab an award winning cupcake there if there's any room left in your stomach! Walk a few more paces and visit the new hangar co-op space. You'll find cool wares and food there too!  Such a fun, family friendly experience at Joe's Farm Grill. You're missing out if you don't make a trip soon!

Hands down best burger joint I've been too. There's nothing I've tried that I didn't like. I LOVE 4B Burger and my wife usually gets the Fontina Burger with a gluten free bun and extra pesto. Don't miss out on choosing  from 4 different kinds of fries or grab their famous onion rings!

BEST BURGER EVER. I had the Fontina burger with zucchini chips & it was great. Tastes like a real cookout burger made with tlc. The zucchini was pretty good. Homemade marinara. So so so good. My roommates both had Bacon BBQ burgers; they liked it.

The Saturday afternoon we stopped in with our dog was stunning, weather-wise. This, of course, meant that the rest of the world also read the many positive Yelp reviews and knew it was the perfect day to stop into Joe's. Why waste a sunny, cool day inside?  I waited in the half-hour-long line while Husband sat in back with the dog at one of the picnic tables once the line started getting inside. There was a worker dude who would helpfully hand out laminated menus to us line-standers and answer any questions we had. He highly suggested the Fontina burger, but I already knew what I wanted: a cheeseburger with sautéed onions, a side of onion rings and fried zucchini, and a chocolate milkshake.   After I ordered, I was given a little buzzer/beeper thingy for when the food was ready. It took just long enough for me to check out their super clean bathroom with the dolls in the walls and the doll movie on the tv before the food was ready. YUM that milkshake! I really liked my cheeseburger, but Husband wasn't too impressed. We both liked the onion rings, but left a lot of the fried zucchini in favor of drinking our milkshakes (he got vanilla bean). My biggest problem actually ended up being the ranch that we requested for the sides... it tasted really off. The consistency wasn't right and it didn't compliment the food at all. I am a firm believer that onion rings need to be dunked in something, so I ended up dunking in my ketchup. It worked, but I wished for something better.  There were a lot of other dogs lying around under picnic tables, so that was pretty cool to see. There is also a bird group that gathers (I'm pretty sure they were parrots, but I can't say for sure. I know they were very colorful and friendly!) some weekends out at one of the front tables while they eat. Parents and kids would wander over to talk to the bird handlers, which was neat. Definitely a family AND dog friendly place.

I live in the neighborhood next to JFG, so I've been here a handful of times. First, be prepared for a long line, any day of the week.  I've had the ahi tuna salad, but if u want an ahi tuna salad go to a sushi restaurant, I don't really recommend that from JFG.  I'm a big fan of the hot dogs, recommend them. Strange tho, that they dont serve a chili dog, or have any chili for that matter. But be warned - they always seem to send me immediately straight for a bathroom, if you know what I mean.... Or maybe it's just me. The BBQ pizza flatbread was a little on the bland side. The date shake was okay, the shakes in the middle of nowhere Dateland, AZ are better. The pumpkin pie shake, however, is delish - recommend highly.  The food is decent, but pretty expensive for just "decent" food, and really long lines. At some point I'm sure I'll go back, since I live right next to it and people who visit always want to try it and see what it's all about because they saw it on Triple D. Rumor has it, that they have good breakfast, which I've never tried, and somewhat interested in.

We ate here with our two kids a few days ago.  My wife had been here before, but I had not.  I loved the food.  I had the BBQ bacon burger, my wife had a simple grilled cheese, and my oldest son had corn dog bites.  We all loved our food.  The food wasn't the best I've ever eaten, but I liked that the restaurant was different than your normal restaurant.    Really enjoyed ourselves.  Will be back.

What a great concept, great place for kids and a great atmosphere. The food is pretty good but a little dry on the chicken, staff was friendly and looked organized. I will deff come here and eat again and cant wait cause the weather is so nice to enjoy outside. also the coffee house next door is great try it

Wow! That sums it up. Great food. The fried shrimp are giant tender and juicy! The garlic fries were delicious. Fried green beans are my favorite. I was not a fan of the fontina burger I ordered it because it was a diners drive in's dives favorite.  I am still giving this place 5 stars there was nothing wrong with the burger, it just did not suit my taste. I will definitely go back. Cool place!

The first time I went here I had a regular hamburger. It was very average, the only reason this restaurant gets hype is because of the atmosphere. I added a star just for that reason, because the outdoor area is cute. The second time I went there I thought I'd try their farm veggie burger. What a mistake... That was the worst veggie burger I have ever had in my life! It was bland, the rice in it was overcooked, I could only eat one bite. The first one they gave me was burnt, so I told the cook. All they did was cook me another one, and it was still bland and disgusting. I would have ordered something else, but I didn't have the money to. That's another issue, this place is overpriced. I'm not sure if I'd come here again.

Super super yummy!  Traditional authentic American food.  I like authenticity, fusion creations can be a bit salty when the chefs try to keep the flavors together.  But farm fresh right to the plate is exactly what I appreciate about this place.  The burgers are big, the shakes are milky and basic, and the fries are awesome! Consistently delivering good quality food.  I like it.

Overrated. Food is meh. Expensive for what you get. Nothing has ever really impressed me. I feel like both of the other "Joe's" establishments are way better (Joe's real BBQ & Liberty Market) - I'd rather go to those any day.

Everything was super fresh. And the food was very delicious. Portions were good as well. When we first arrived there was a little bit of a line, but you can tell the servers have a lot of practice and were able to move through the line very smoothly.  As we were eating we noticed that the line was even much longer, burnt the time we finished eating the line had once again disappeared.    We will be heading back there for sure, and soon

Have been here 3 times and, honestly, I don't understand the fuss. Maybe because it was featured on diners, drive ins and dives? The food is good, but not smack your mama good. A fairly simple menus with family- friendly dining is what you'll get, nothing more, nothing less.

I will say the food is AMAZING! The butter pecan shake and garlic fries are wonderful - I am alway down for that combo! However, my husband has experienced problems when modifying his order. Normally he gets a chicken sandwich with just meat, cheese, and lettuce. He will ask for second piece of chicken to add to it - and every single time they seem to not get it right. I personally love the food enough to come back, but if only they can get our order right!
One of my favorite places to get a burger and sit outside in the shade under the trees. Very laid back and kid and dog friendly.

Had lunch here the other day, it was great! They do an excellent job of getting you through the line and taking your order even when it's packed! The food was delicious and came out fast. Servers were friendly and helpful.
Love the Ahi Tuna burgers -  cannot forget to mention those garlic fries.
Would have given them 5 stars, but they only have 2 restrooms for the whole restaurant.  But, aside from that, the food is great, the service is awesome, and I love the atmosphere.

This is one of my husband's favorite restaurants and we love that we can eat outdoors here.  The menu has a lot of great food and the quantities are large, so often my husband and I will split one thing and get either onion rings or the garlic fries.  We love their BBQ Chicken Pizza, too.    Any of their burgers and salads that we've tried are good.  So yummy.  And, they are always so friendly.  That is why there is often a long line to get into the place.  Even though, the line does move quickly.  This is a great place for the family to eat and for dates with my husband with the kids.    The food is delicious.  The ribs are cooked differently than Joe's Real BBQ, but they are delicious nonetheless.    The atmosphere, surroundings of Joe's is also very comforting and peaceful.  We love Joe's Farm Grill.  And it's not too far from where we live either!
Great food, Quick service and a great location down town. Keeping it simple. Great place for a lunch meeting or after work hanging out with friends and family. I loved the ribs!

Ok, so the first time I went I got the chicken sandwhich and thought it was ok. But the second time I got the burger that was on tv with onion rings. It was AMAZING!  If your going to go somewhere because they are famous for something get what they are famous for!

This is a fun place to come for a local restaurant! It was featured on Diners Drive ins and Dives and is worthy of its feature. I personally like the chicken sandwich, the grilled cheese, and garlic fries. My husband loves the buffalo chicken sandwich. Sometimes there is a long wait, but it is worth it! There is something for everyone in the family and has a very fun atmosphere. The picnic tables in the back under the trees are perfect for the family to hang out and enjoy a yummy dinner.

I don't know why so many are crazy for this dive.  I have eaten lunch there many times when working in the area.  The food is good, but not remarkable.  The line to get in the place is insane - way too long and way too slow - which is the reason for my 2-star rating.  I've yet to find a restaurant worth waiting this long in line for - this one included.  The decor is definitely low class dump.  The dining room is packed at lunch, often with screaming kids.  There is seating outside, but the Arizona summer makes this downright dangerous.  Joe's is best if you can do an early lunch and I mean EARLY.  Getting there at 1130 doesn't cut it.  Try 1045 or 1100 unless you like wasting your lunch hour standing in a line out the front door.  Eat there if you must, but there are many other better options within a couple of blocks.

A group of us went to eat at Joe's Farm Grill. This is the epitome of a non fancy dining experience! To be honest, it was crowded, we had to wait in line, and the decor is not something to write home about, however, the food was good. Rather than write all the comments given to me by my companions, I have chosen to write some of them down verbatim.  "The ahi tuna sandwich looked really good, and one of our party really enjoyed it. The burgers were nice and big, and I couldn't believe the size of the fried shrimp. The ribs were really tasty, and the pulled pork was some of the best I've ever had. All in all, a good time was had by all."  "I've also never seen a bathroom with a television in it before! Quite the experience."  "The grilled salmon platter was delicious. I could have taken home a tub of the garlic aioli, it was so good!"  Its a bit of an unusual experience to go there, but it's a great place for families especially with a bunch of kids.  3 stars for quality and amount of food.

My family visited for the dad and my dad was set on trying this place.   One of the coolest places I have been to in Gilbert and the scenery definitely made the meal. I ordered the ahi sandwich, bbq chicken pizza, farm burger. For the sides we had fried green beans and garlic fries.  Between me, my mom, and my dad we all had different favorites so I will just say everything was really good. We finished our meal to milk shakes which were also yummy and walking around the properties.  The entire experience was awesome and really made the visit with my parents extra special

7/07/10  Don't get me wrong, I still love JFG; I just didn't care for its BBQ pulled pork sandwich and fries.  The coleslaw was good, but not so fantastic that it's worth the pain after.  I thought that the pork had too much of the cloyingly-sweet sauce.  Wasn't so sweet when paired w/ the garlic toast points.  However, if you look at the included photo, you'll see that the two pieces of bread were under the pork, and therefore completely saturated w/ sauce.  I like accompanying bread to be crispy/crusty (love that crunch!), so all I had to enjoy that afternoon w/ the pork was the part that stuck out from under all that sauced meat!  What a waste (tsk, tsk)!  The boat of fries was just a complete soggy mess.  I should've asked them to sub sweet potato fries instead, but why must I pay extra to get a perfectly crisped product?  Then again, one (wo)man's treasure is another (wo)man's trash, and vice-versa, eh?  Today wasn't a great day for me w/ regards to Mr. Johnston's two restaurants (see my "recent" Coffee Shop review).  I hope my next visit to a Johnston concept yields a happier adventure!

Went to Joe's on a whim and it payed off!  The food was diner fare with a twist on modern. Many have stated before the fontina burger is OMG! Oozing with fontina cheese, mushrooms, red peppers and farm goodness. So get it, you will be grateful to cows.  I was eying the people who ordered pizza and almost asked for a slice to try...but alas bad form.  Will I go back, sure...the drive is a little daunting but the food is oh so appealing.

Absolutely delicious. I took my girlfriends that were visiting from all over the country to Joe's Farm Grill - after taking them to a bunch of fancy restaurants in Scottsdale no less. Joe's beat out the competition across the board. I highly recommend the farm burger with blue cheese and grilled onions. And don't forget to substitute with sweet potato fries!

"Hidden Gem".. Very Tasty and Reasonable prices...I will Definitely be returning..Relocating from The Midwest..I'm Soo Happy to have FINALLY!! found some Decent food in Az.. Joes Farm Grill is just as Awesome!

People were extremely polite and professional with big smiles on their faces. Both my wife and I ordered the Farm Burger and we both absolutely loved the burger and fries. The young lady warned me about the level of heat and spice on the pepper jack cheese and I was pleasantly surprised. Extremely good food and very nice staff. We will be going back soon.

I heard everyone rave about this place but I was disappointed.  The wait in line to order was almost 30 min.  To me that is ridiculous when you can walk into another restaurant and get served immediately.  I also thought their prices were high when their food was just okay.

Last Sunday, second day in the Phoenix area...  Blame Yelp for this review... I would have never found this attraction on my own!  Joe's Farm Grill is housed in a Tomorrowland-like building construction with Glass and Steel framing that was pretty popular during the 50s when architects during that era deemed the use of a lot of Glass the wave of the future. A "get-it-yourself" fountain drink dispenser is located outside the building... which makes it available for the people sitting in the outside Patio and at the Picnic Tables... but it's kind of a hassle for diners inside, that do not prefer the "fresh air". As I walked into the establishment... I was very surprised to see another Disneyland-like feature seen only at amusement parks...  a snake-like waiting-line area. I had to pinch myself... Where was I? Disneyland or Gilbert, Arizona?   The actual Dining area is divided into two spaces... the front area has a dual function of being an ordering area and a dining area; there is also a rear dining area more suited for larger groups such as families separated by a see-through wall.   First impression after ordering and being handed a beeper to notify us when our order was ready... Dang, it's HUMID in here! At 10am on a Sunday, with the restaurant only 2/3rds full... the humidity was a little irritating... I would not like this place later in the day when occupancy reaches 100% and the temperature reached 110 degrees.  FLIES, FLIES... and more Flies!!! This was my second observation... In the waiting time for the Buzzer to go off, I had performed the following entomological analysis... You have two kinds of this nuisance at Joe's Farm Grill... Before you get your food, you get buzzed around your dome by these real-small flies that are attracted by your body orifices. Then... after you get your meal, the small guys disappear and then you have to deal with larger flies that are attracted by your food. I don't know which ones were worse... the Big Flies going after your food, or the Teeny-Weeny ones trying to use you as a human incubator for their progeny. Yes, I had THAT much time while waiting for the Beeper to start Flashing! All this despite the Orkin fluorescent Bug-Killers! Take me out of this friggin' Healthy Outdoors!   SWAT! SWAT! SWAT! Now for the Food Review...   PLASTIC PLATES???  All entrees are served on Black Plastic plates - another AMUSEMENT PARK feature!!! When I picked up my meal for my friend and I, I thought to myself... "Joe's Farm Grill is actually receiving 4-Stars... for using Plastic Plates?!?!". Of course, the plastic must be recyclable or environmentally friendly. I don't know of any other restaurant on Yelp that can get away with this without getting penalized in the ratings...  Pancakes & Fresh Fruit (**** 1/2 $6.49) Stack of Four, Fresh Fruit, Whipped Cream and Syrup. Smaller than average Pancakes, but the Pancakes were made just right with very good consistency; Fruit consisted of quite a bit of Blueberries, Raspberries, and Strawberries. VERY, Very good.  Meat & Potato Scramble (** 1/2 $7.99) Skillet Potatoes, Bacon, Sausage, & Ham with four Cheeses. A less than memorable Scramble... maybe because it was SALTY!!! Healthful? NOPE!   This Scramble could have been the Freshest Scramble ever... Would have never known that with the Saltiness masking everything.  Iced Tea (*** $1.99) All you can drink in a smallish cup... if you get it yourself... OUTSIDE... in the 110 degree HEAT!   Afterwards, my friend and I walked outside, to get away from the architectural masterpiece I refer to as a humidifier, where the most impressive part of the restaurant location was... the humongous Trees! But, I have to wonder why anyone would Picnic underneath these trees, though... You have to wonder why all the limbs are supported by HUGE steel Stanchions, as large as the limbs they're supporting, embedded in the ground. And... hasn't anyone that pic-nicked under the trees read the warning signs for falling branches and the danger of climbing on said branches?  Last observation... which is the most disconcerting... With the restaurant 2/3rds of capacity.... only two couples of "color"? Look around you when you arrive at Joe's... you can perform the math yourself. Unfortunately, I notice things like that...  I also noticed quite a few reviews that mention the TV show, "Diners,  Drive-In's & Dives"... When has a TV show been the arbiter of what is a good restaurant? Frankly, I'd rather "find" my favorite dining establishments myself.   I really admire the idea of Self-Sufficiency and Sustainability in the Joe's Farm Grill which supposedly results in better Health for the patrons and Fresh Produce for the restaurant. Does this result in "good" food compared to "other" less-healthful, non-sustainable restaurants? Regrettably, No.

Everything that we tried on the means was soooooo delicious! You could really taste the difference in the quality of food. The staff was kind and our food came quick. The atmosphere was was fun. We will be back!

Great food but pricey. Was excited to go there for my birthday and have to say the staff ruined it. We called ahead to see if they had pizza (the only thing there my little one will eat there) and were told they did. When we got there 20 minutes later were told they that no pizza and were all but laughed at when we explained we even called ahead and were told they did. No offer to help and no manager to be found. Huge disappointment and epic fail for the staff and their condescending attitude.

Yummy yummy yummy! This place is just an absolutely awesome place for breakfast!  My friend had the Green Eggs and Ham and I was jealous over my perfectly cooked Belgian Waffle with fruit. The ambience is amazing ; you sit outside next to the beautiful garden where the spices and veggies are growing.  Another Triple D find right in my neighborhood!  I'll be going again and again!
Fantastic onion rings! Outrageous tiger shrimp! Ridiculous sweet potato pie & blueberry-bourbon cheesecake! Don't walk, run to this establishment for tastilicious entrees!

A walk around the Riparian Preserve had given us an appetite, so we stopped in here for dinner. As soon as I saw the Yelp sticker on the door, I knew we were in for a good meal.   Above the ordering counter are TV screens featuring the episode of DD&D they were on. It was because of these (and my general level of starvation at the time) that I was willing to cough up the funds for an $8 burger.  While it wasn't as mouth-wateringly delicious as a BluBurger, it was certainly tasty, as were the sweet potato fries. My friend ordered the ribs, which she loved, and which have fed her for several meals since. Also, the regular fries are deelish.  One oddity is that all the drinks and condiments are outside. I wonder how the mayo holds up in 115° weather?

Cute touristy spot. Prices aren't too bad, but there's a LONG line almost all the time so be prepared to wait!   Great place to take pictures.  Nice looking coffee shop next door - haven't visited yet but it's on my list.
It's a nice atmosphere and delicious food! The bathroom is definitely a must see, you would never expect it.

Joe's is my favorite place in Gilbert! Farm Fresh food, fun atmosphere, and great service. What more could I ask for! I try something different every time I go, but I always get that blackberry lemonade! So fresh and delicious. Living less than a mile from here is dangerous! Keep killing it Joe's!

Joe's is awesome. It's a great place to go for a mom's lunch when you have to bring the little ones cause they can play outside. The food is good (except the fried stuff is on the greasy side - esp the fried green beans.) I love getting the beets with goat cheese and the grilled veggie pizza. It's just a fun, casual hang out.  -- Oh, the bathrooms are cool, and I love the outside handwashing station.
Food is great! Big portions and worth the money. Lots of variety and a really fun atmosphere. It's really nice to sit outside. The lines can be long though so be prepared!

First time I have ever eaten at Joes Farm Grill  I have eaten at Joe's BBQ, which has great food so I was expecting the same...... Well I got better. We had breakfast and it was delecious. By far the best bacon I have ever had. I got a waffle as well and it was so fluffy and tasty. I have yet to try the lunch and dinner menu but the breakfast will keep me coming back. Outdoor seating is nice and if its to warm inside is avaliable as well :)

We lived about a 1/2 mile away from the farm grill and would pass it almost everyday. it always looked like an interesting place  and knew the ingredients were fresh with the huge field right next door. After we saw it on food network, we knew we had to go check it out. We were not disappointed at all.   The first time (of several) that we have been, I got a burger with the bleu cheese on it ( I can't remember the name of it off hand) but it was cooked perfectly and I made the perfect choice of having onion rings instead of fries. OMG they were good. We have tried almost everything on the menu with that original burger and onion rings being my favourite so far.  When people come into town, we usually try to take them to the farm grill and no one has ever had a bad meal or walked away disappointed. if someone asks me where to get some good food, I instantly think of Joe's Farm Grill.  Oh yeah, the drink station and bathrooms are cool!

Consistently good. Shakes are awesome. Deep fried green beans are my favorite. Everything is fresh, local, or organic. Worth the trip. We love to bring a blanket and eat out on the grass. Family friendly.

I used to like this place quite a bit. Food was never anything amazing considering the price but was decent and the ambiance and atmosphere was always pleasant plus my kids enjoyed the sights and sounds. Ate here a few days ago following the remodel and aside from a little more indoor seating was surprised to see nothing else had really changed. Still one cashier who was rude and some good menu items now gone. Also, did the burgers shrink or buns grow?  Food quality was rather lackluster.   The worst change however was the absolutely horrific drink selection. The tractor soda is without question the nastiest stuff ever created. I looked around and 99% of people were drinking water or tea and anyone who tried the organic fountain drinks immediately dumped them out. Joes farm grill will survive off name and reputation regardless of my review but man what a disappointment it is now. My wife and I agreed the day we were there that there was no longer any point in going there and added it to our list of places we no longer need to visit. On the plus side I'll save $50 bucks on lunches and add minutes to my life doing other things then waiting in line for mediocre food and drinks.

A bit pricey but worth it.  The atmosphere here is all the best things of living in Arizona.  A neighborhood bar, local food, outdoor community seating and the DATE SHAKES are to die for!  Whether you are there for breakfast, lunch, dinner or just a snack this place won't disappoint.
I went here for the first time on Saturday and it was great!  I had the grill cheese and salad both delicious. The atmosphere is really cool too. Nice to eat outside. Highly recommended.

Finally went here with some friends for dinner tonight after wanting to check it out for a long time.  The BBQ chicken pizza lived up to the hype.  The same for the chocolate shake.  I also really enjoyed the sweet potato fries though I still think the Breakfast Club's are the best in the known universe.  I also snagged one of my friend's onion rings and it was pretty darn good, too.  I'll be sure to get those next time.  The quantity and quality of the food is definitely worth the price.  But the decor inside was disappointing.  I would recommend coming here on a nice afternoon so that you can sit outside.  Absolutely do not come here on a winter evening like we did since we were all freezing and our food got cold fast.
Absolutely incredible this place is. The food is so fresh they grow it mostly on the farm there. Sashimi grade tuna sandwich was out of this world. Great place to bring out of town guests.

Been here several times over the last few years and tried something new each time. Nothing has ever wowed me. It wasn't bad, but nothing outstanding. I keep going back thinking they were just having a bad day, but most items are just bland.

Joe's Farm Grill was recommended by a friend who went their twice on their last visit to Arizona.  She raved about the food and the date shakes.  Yup, DATE SHAKES!    So during our Spring Training trip to Arizona, we had to go to Joe's Farm Grill.  A heads up - there is a long line to place your order.  But, the atmosphere is so nice and with good company, the line moves along nicely with great conversation.  If you have little ones, there is plenty of space to run around and they even supply sidewalk chalk to help occupy them.  If you can, grab a menu while you're in line because if you're like me, you're not going to be able to decide what you want right away!  Tempting gourmet burgers, sandwiches and salads... pizza and BBQ... fresh beet salad and DATE SHAKES!    I chose the Seared Ahi Sandwhich which was delicious.  I would have liked the tuna to be a little more rare, but the condiments and the bread more than made up for the over-cooked tuna.  And the date shake did not disappoint!  It was so refreshing and lightly sweet!

I would have to agree first & foremost with the FLY INFESTATION theory! they really really REALLY need to control it, being indoors doesnt stop them at all!! last time 2 of us went there it somehow came up to $50 which was insane! they are good but....  coleslaw is very very plain/flavorless, i still eat it. the ribs are very good, shakes = good, atmosphere good. I do have to agree it does get very loud sometimes, generally quiet and not busy in the early afternoon. OH DO NOT I REPEAT, DO NOT SUBSTITUTE ANYTHING FOR THE FRIES i substituted onion rings they added on $2 more and gave me like 5 onion rings!!! I do like the fact they seperate the trash/plastic/recycling etc.. im sure ill be back WITH MY OWN FLYSWATTER!!!!!!!

So the management of Joe's contacted me about my experience.  They genourously offered a giftcard for a revisit.  I can honestly say that shocked me tremendously.  While Joe's is a pretty far drive for me, I thought it only fair to give them a second shot.  My second experience was definitely better than the first.  We switched it up and tried the pizza and fish sandwich. had to get the onion rings also, to see if the ones from my first visit were unusually bad.  I am happy to report that the food this time around was much better.  The onion rings this time around were crisp and fresh.  The ingredients are fresh, and you can definitely taste it.  Overall I believe my first experience was a random fluke....I guess every place has a 'bad day.  Overall I would give Joe's 4 stars, BUT, customer service is huge, and I appreciate being contacted regarding my prior experience, so the 5th star is for excellent customer service.

joe's farm grill is the perfect substitute when i am in need of joe's real bbq, but low on gas. this place is right next door to my regular caffeine fix (the coffee shop) and close to my humble abode. the owner, joe, has essentially bottled up retro dining mixed with great service and sold it.   joe converted his old home into a fresh, order-at-the-counter style grub hut. the menu has all the essentials: ribs and pork sandwiches, chicken everything, hot dogs, grilled cheese...and sides galore. the fountain drinks and condiments are located outside (restrooms too!). be patient with the poor mayo. it comes slow, but steady.  i've only been here a handful of times, but so far: so wonderful. the pulled pork sandwich tastes just like the one at his bbq restaurant. the fire-roasted broccoli is a yummy side. i like to eat outside under the misters and soak in the children's laughter as they frolic to their heart's content. the farm grill has such a wholesome vibe. it's a good day in the neighborhood at joe's!

So bummed about my experience today.  Usually I would rate Joe's Farm Grill a 4 or 5, but today I was greeted by a shock.  The usually delicious pesto chicken salad is a bite of flavor and wonder. It was with this expectation I phoned in a to go order today.  When I got home I found the sandwich burned.  The only tasty today is char.  :(. Everybody has a bad day, so let's hope today was it.

Cute cute location and atmosphere.  Eating outside here for lunch on the tables is very serene, and it's a nice stroll outside to look at the different gardens the farm has.  The onion rings were very crispy and flavorful, and I had the tuna sandwich which was a very big portion and very tasty (albeit messy).  I wasn't impressed by the strawberry milkshake, which did not have enough strawberry flavor to distinguish it much from a vanilla shake.  The prices are a bit high, but the ingredients are high quality.

Overrated. This place is obviously unique scenery-wise. It is neat that they use local food that was grown around here. The burger is what I had. It was decent but didn't blow me away. I heard the chicken is good though. I would suggest not sitting outside unless you want flies all over you. (This could happen to be just this time of the year). The place is usually packed which may force you to sit outside.

My wife and I spent a perfect afternoon at Joe's enjoying the beautiful weather. Lots of outside seating under the trees provided a great time. She has driven past this place and always wanted to stop, but finally got the chance while we were waiting on her car to be serviced. I have only been one other time and it was a few years ago. I always think it is further from our house than it really is.   We arrived and the line to order was to the door, but it moved quickly. They had two lunch specials that day: a pork tenderloin sandwich and a Gouda bacon garlic burger. We ordered one of each. She had the beet salad side and I the onion rings. The onion rings were huge, and the beets were not that bad either. I tried to eat the sandwich normally, but it was so huge. I tried to fold it over, but ended up just eating it with a fork and knife. A lady came around while we were line and announced the specials. I am not sure if she was a manager or the owner, but she sold it. While we were outside she came around two times talking to people and making sure everything was good. Excellent personal touch of customer service. She also talked up the pecan milkshake so we had to get that before we left. Great place and I am already eager to go back.

i like dis place.  so, please know that this place can get very crowded. its also on the "expensive" side, in my opinion. the good news is, they have a ton of seating and they give you a lot of food so you do get what you pay for.  i have ordered a veggie burger with a side of fries here twice. it is awesome and super filling. a good veg option. the fries are yummy as well! BUUUUUUT  the fried greens beans tho  order them. my brother got them as a side with his burger and i wanted to eat. them. all.  SO GOOD. i'd also recommend the onion rings because they are crunchy and seasoned to perfection.  my son and my dad love their milkshakes. my mom loves several of their salads. i think you cannot go wrong if you bring a bunch of people here, there is something for everyone

We've been here twice, once for coffee/breakfast at their place in the back and the next for dinner to sample the burgers I had read about.  I love the ambiance here and the casual dining on picnic tables outside on their lovely grounds, and the food is a notch above decent, and fresh, for sure.  We will most likely be back, just because it's a cool little spot with good food.
Everything here is amazing! The atmosphere, fresh food, and relaxation! The Fontana burger was the best and I would totally recommend!

Decided to come out here after seeing it on a episode on the Food Network. We were pleasantly surprised that the line moved so quickly and fortunately for us the weather was really nice so sitting outside was a bonus. We ordered a chicken sandwich for the MIL, a Ahi Tuna Salad for the wife and I got the bacon, garlic gouda burger.   My only real gripe is that I asked how the burgers were cooked. I was initially told medium rare, and then told no that it would be pink. I told them I was OK with that just that I hated overcooked, dry burgers. Unfortunately when the burger arrived there was no pink and it was more on the medium well side. Enough toppings on the burger to help out, but disappointing as the burger itself was on the dry side. We had 18 mo old with us who was non-stop so we didn't bother having it remade. We'd try them again if in the area. A bit expensive though as it was $51 for three people.

Enjoyable burger not quite worth the drive. Drove from Arcadia, to Gilbert to finally try Joe's Farm and Grill.  I had a BBQ Burger which was very good and the fried zucchini was tasty as well.  Both my wife and I were disappointed with the fries, as they were luke warm, soggy, and clearly not made to order.  The setting is also very nice as they have both indoor and outdoor(shaded) seating.  However, in order to have a great burger joint great fries are a must.  I do not think we will make the drive again.

The line to order was SLOOOOW, but food was pretty great. I had the burger (the fontina... I think...) it was featured on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. It was very good. My girlfriend ordered the thai salad with no dressing, which they messed up on, but they fixed it quickly... it was pretty delicious as well.
Trying too hard... they changed their soda fountain to a odd organic brand. Fix the pancakes and coffee. Even the staff won't drink it. They go next door.

Okay, a lot of reviews on this place so I will get right to the points.  Pros: 1. One of the best American Grill style restaurants you can find in town, maybe the best. 2. Great atmosphere, sitting outside is nice when its not hot. 3. Food is very fresh. 4. Food comes out quick once its ordered  Cons: 1. Long lines, expect long wait just to order when its busy. 2. Not the cleanest restaurant that I have been to, I can see its hard to keep all tables/chairs clean when they have so many customers. 3. Possible long line to fill up the drinks 4. Only two family restrooms, line again!  Bottom line, I do recommend this restaurant to everyone, must pick a not so busy time.

Joe's atmosphere gives off this uncomfortable vibe like you're enclosed from the rest of the world. But the food is the freshest food I've eaten anywhere. I had the 4B burger with garlic fries and a vanilla milkshake. Unreal. Every part of the burger was bursting with fresh flavor. The garlic fries and milkshake were perfect complements. Others in my party had the rib and pork combo that had a very strong smokey flavor. Overall, an excellent place to enjoy the nuances of earths finest foods!

We really enjoyed this place. The outdoor seating is great for keeping a toddler occupied and we absolutely love the garlic green beans. The garlic fries were good too but if you have to choose go for the beans!!

A good friend of mine's parents live in Gilbert and he had recommended Joe's Farm Grill when I told him I'd be in town...and I'm glad he did. This is my 4th time here and every time I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The food is amazingly fresh and the service is great. I've tried my fair share of food and I'm yet to find something that wasn't great. The onion rings are a standout item that I would definitely recommend and the Fontina Burger is also a staple. I've eaten next door at their other restaurant named 'The Coffee Shop' and I loved it just as much. I've heard great things about Joe's BBQ, but haven't had a chance to give it a try yet...but it's next on my list.

I enjoy going to Joe's Farm Grill, not just because of the food (utterly amazing onion rings), but also because of the surrounding location.  There are huge, interesting looking trees, beautifully kept grounds, and interesting architecture.    It can be quite crowded, which takes away from the ambiance.  But if you go during off hours (in our case, Superbowl Sunday - hey... no Cards... no point in watching), the crowds are minimal and the grounds are very peaceful, which makes it nice to enjoy the food and the mild February weather.

Food is really good & fresh  The seating area indoors smelled pretty bad an was off putting . Really should eat outside anyway to get the full effect . I would go back again but not when it's 100 plus degrees outside

I like the atmosphere. Great for large gatherings. But sometimes it's crowded & hard to move around inside. Go early!!! I also feel the food is a bit overpriced. But they do feed you for free on your birthday!

This is disappointing for the price. Nothing compared to Joes BBQ. Wont be back. Carl's Jr has a lot better burgers and cheaper. The Farmhouse in downtown Gilbert's coleslaw puts this coleslaw to shame.   Expensive, $34 for two people. For that price we should have had a server. We had to ask someone to clean the tables.   Place is styled like a food court at a theme park but at least there you get better food.  Won't ever be back.
Amazing food very farm fresh just make sure you are prepared to wait in line if you go during prime time on the weekends. I have never had a bad meal!

I loved the feel of this restaurant. When you first pull up you see a huge line. The line moves pretty quickly though. You get to sit in a wonderful area and have fabulous food.   Great spot for kids or if you want to bring your dogs.   The milkshake was to die for.

what a great place. good food and friendly service. but the best of all is the Farm. you can see where all the fresh herbs come form that go into your food. and what a great place to bring the family and guests form out of town... the pizza is to die for.... WOW !
Went 2 weeks ago and it was delish. The whole gang talked and ate and laughed. A warm breeze blew, the food was tasty and way reasonable. Chandler/Gilbert, AZ has a lot to offer. Don't miss it!

Savored every bite of the Ahi Tuna burger with sweet potato fries. Cole slaw had a little too much onions for my taste. Guy Fieri's recommendations were right on.  My hubby enjoyed the Fontina Burger another must have according to Mr. Fieri. Great place to hang out for great food.  Don't let the lines fool you... It moves fast and worth the short wait. Very casual, so come ready to sit on picnic tables around there grassy lawns. Oh their Medjool Date shake is a perfect sweet treat to your meal. Yummy!

My sister is not adventurous when it comes to dining experiences.  Her idea of good eating is to go to a restaurant she's been to a billion times to order the same item over and over.  So getting her to eat anywhere that she's never been is hard work!  I convinced her to try out Joe's Farm Grill with me today.  I drive by it on my way to work and on my way to the dog park on a regular basis and was curious about the place.  Was it a farm?  A restaurant? A produce stand?  But I'd forget about looking it up as soon as I drove by!  Well finally I looked it up and was delighted to find out it was a retro-style casual eating place that had (also) featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  So, I named dropped Guy to my sister and she reluctantly agreed to try it out.  I had the fontina burger (dip it in ranch AND ketchup!) and the onion rings, while she had the grilled cheese sandwich and chili fries.  Everything was fresh, hot, not greasy like you'd expect, and amazingly delicious!  Afterward, we walked across the lot to The Coffee Shop where I had a yummy iced latte and we both had "glam" cupcakes.  This place is a great place for a casual lunch or dinner.  It's definitely kid-friendly, and even a fun and casual place for a date!  I could even see the potential of throwing a party outside in their patio area.  As for my sister?  She's a total convert.  As soon as we got home, she was on the phone with her boyfriend, gushing about the delicious place we'd just been to, with its retro layout, delicious food, and the too-cute coffee shop!
I love this place. The atmosphere is great, the food is delish! Plus, they have sweet potato fries, my favorite!!

Tuesday night we decided to have dinner at Joe's Farm Grill.  Apparently this used to be an old house turned "Dinner".  My friend kept telling us how great this place is, so we thought we would give it a try.  It's and interesting place but honestly wasn't much different than going to In & Out Burger (walk up - place order -  pick up at window).  It did have a few stylish décor items and kitchy concepts like the soda & sauce fountain station outside (next to the bathroom).
