A casual, diner-type atmosphere, with food orders submitted at a front window and orders collected at another.  This place is a draw, and consequently the line at the order window can get to be a little long.  We think up to a 20-minute wait is worth it.  The coffee shop in the same parking lot is a great place to hang out, and it too has a great menu for a small coffee shop.

Joe's, I want to love you but I don't. I think there are two types of people that go here. People that know the food is average and people who are in denial because of its geography. Your food is extra "meh" with a side of "Hmmm."  We have been here many times. The set-up is terrific. We make the trek and take our dog to nearby Cosmo Dog Park... then hop over for pizza, hamburgers, salads, etc. (I think we've tried just about everything... to no avail. How do you screw up BBQ pizza??)  Since I may sound like a Negative Nelly, I will say I dig the milkshakes.  So why is it so popular?   This is a haven for East Valley apologists who want to have a signature restaurant to call their own but don't want to drive into "the city." Look into your hearts, people of Mesa / Gilbert. Enough of the charade. You saw it on Food Network and you're happy there's some place there with a line out the door.

Food is really good, and portion sizes are amazing but I always leave feeling like I paid the right amount and the wait was worth it.   Never had a bad experience, but always had a terrific one either... Just lives up to the hype for me.

First off let me tell you I am a big fan...they have Motorcycle Parking right out front! Unfortunately I got there around 11:45am and they stop serving breakfast at 11am. What the Hell? I am all about breakfast, and would have loved to try some of their Yummy selections...that is for another visit. The place is pretty awesome, and they are totally smart with the technology. There is a video monitors that show menu items being made, the place on Diners, Drive-Thrus, and Dives, and full copies of the menu. This is a great thing to do, as I am all about something to occupy my time while I wait. I had the Fontina Burger and the Pesto that was on it might have been some of the best Pesto I have had. Fries were hot and crisp. The condiment station is laid out well, with a little sink to wash your hands right there (everyone take note...wash those hands). The ingredients were nice and fresh, bun grilled to perfection, and it was a beautiful sunny day out, so we sat outside. The restrooms were super clean and very unique (TV above the Urinal, and action figures above the Toilet, it is UniSex by the way).  I will so be back to try Joes Farm Grill again!

After countless reruns on Triple D, Joe's Farm Grill became a pit stop during a business trip. The building is unique in it's layout and decor, looks like a diner from the Jetsons. Great food and definitely fresh! Will come back if in town again.

Love the outdoor seating at picnic tables, which is perfect during our cooler months.  Have only eaten breakfast here, but it's always been great.  Only downfall is long line to order and have to pick up your food...personally I like to be served, but that is just the style of this place.

That's what I'm talking about! So this place has had some dishes featured on DDD which is a good sign but not necessarily a guarantee of great food. Well it did not disappoint. Really good barbecue and some creative excellent dishes. The Ahi tuna sandwich was a stand out. Really appreciate the quality and freshness. Nice environment too with outdoor seating in a park like setting. Bobby Chay knows good food and Bobby Chay likey very much.

If I were a good critic every experience I've had at Joe's Farm Grill would be rated a 10 on friendliness of staff... expediting my order... and food quality was excellent. So on my review I would say get down there! You won't be disappointed!
Absolutely delicious food! I love the environment too! It has a great friendly staff and great food to match!!

Love Love Love this place. I always take visitors here and they also love it. You simply can't go wrong. Some of my favorites are the portebello mushroom burger, veggie pizza, tuna sandwich, and sweet potato fries. You should def come here on your birthday because you get a $10 credit toward your meal.

Something happened with the new upgrade...im not sure what it is :(  But while the environment is awesome and i love the farm vibe, the food quality seems to have gone down a lot.  I tried a little bit of what everyone had at our table and it was such a disappointment.  The fried shrimp tasted greasy and lacked flavor, the fried zucchini was floppy, the french fries were cold, the pizza was tough.  The whole new soda machines are really awful, none of our kids like the flavor of the homemade sodas. Its such a shame because we use to love this place and now we no longer do.

Joe's Farm Grill is a wonderful place to grab lunch, I was there the other day and they have a wide assortment of healthy meal options that are out of this world. There's nothing better than knowing that you're getting a nutritious meal as well as beautiful scenery to go with it.

Healthy food that tastes good!? I've found the Pink Unicorn of everyone's dreams! Seriously, they will adjust any menu item to keto friendly, and there is literally something for everyone here. The best part is leaving satisfied without feeling guilty!

I've lived in the Bay Area for the last six years and when I moved to Arizona, I had my doubts on the food here.   Joe's Farm Grill exceeded my expectations of breakfast and lunch food items.   What I got:  Fontina Burger. Rating:  4/5  BBQ Chicken Pizza. Rating:  4/5 Farm Burger. Rating:  3/5 Sweet Potato Fries. Rating 4/5 Traditional Eggs. Rating 4/5  The Traditional Eggs are unlike anything I've ever ate. Its light, fresh, and has doesn't leave you with that heavy breakfast feeling. Unlike IHOP or Denny's, its feels very healthy and the feeling where you've got all the protein in your diet to start the day.   The BBQ Chicken Pizza was also great - It's huge enough to share for two people. It's a flat bread pizza that I'm also a huge fan of!   Overall, this is one of my favorite breakfast places in the Phoenix area. It has also been in featured on the Food Network and a place where I take visitors.
Not too expensive but not too good either.  Only had their breakfast (egg tacos). It was flavorless.  I would skip this place.
Super fresh. Like spicy? Get pepper jack on something. Order green goodness dressing on the side. Portobello sandwich, burger, Buffalo chicken sandwich, zucchini side... Very tasty and affordable.

Great area. Lots of kids running around. Definitely a family place. The menus has options for the whole family! Overall the food was pretty standard. Nothing outrageously great but a good place to go for verity

My family came here on a Saturday to celebrate my birthday.  They advertise a free birthday entree on your day of celebration.  I even showed the guy who took our order my drivers license, and he wished me a Happy Birthday.  When we got home home and looked at the receipt, they had charged us for my meal.  I ordered the veggie burger with sweet potato fries but when it was delivered the server had to take it back because it wasn't a veggie burger.  This place is always super busy and just feels disorganized.  The food is good and we really enjoy sitting outside.  It's great for kids to be able to play while you eat too.  I just wish the staff could do a better job of getting things right.

Had the bbq pizza. Not bad. The crust was wonderful. The sauce was good but the randomly place bleu cheese chunks detracted from the flavor. The ahi tuna sandwich was good. The slaw was large. The bun got a little soggy. The vanilla shake made with real vanilla bean stole the show. Very good

Hands down the best local restaurant in Gilbert! The food was fresh, the service was great, and the food didn't take long at all once I ordered it. It is a great atmosphere and really cool how the farm is right behind the restaurant. It's not pricey at all and a great place to take the family, I would suggest going later at night around 7:30 or 8 because if you go earlier than that you will be waiting in line for a while!

Food not worth the wait. Stood in line for 50 minutes just to order. Saw the (presumably) owner headed out for the day stop and chat with some people in front of us in line. Mentioned just how busy they have been. Saw the obviously long line and didn't do anything to address the situation. Yep, the entire time only one of their two order windows was open. One.  I guess I'm the sucker and the joke's on me.

We used to go here quite a bit and just recently visited again. I will break it down to the pros and cons.   Pros: Beautiful outdoor space Good quality food  Cons: Inside eating area was dirty/out dated Customer service is definitely lacking  Long lines (only one cashier at lunch time)  About customer service:  My salmon was raw on the inside. Not under cooked- it was raw. I took it back up to the counter and they gave me attitude. The guy said "that's the way we make it here." I felt as if I was inconveniencing them. They said "we can make you a new one but you're going to have to wait- there's a lot of orders ahead of you and the salmon takes time." I waited, and waited. Everyone in my party was done eating already when I finally say down to eat. I think for the reputation they have they could do a better job making people feel welcome. I didn't actually kind having to wait- but I do mind the way I was treated.   Also, there were so many flies and Mosquitos when we were there this last time. They are re-seeding the lawn and there were puddles of standing water.  In the inside dining area there were stains all over and it smelled musty.   I might wait some time to eat there again.

My family and I love this place to pieces. I always order the BBQ sampler and shrimp platter; I'm Greedy. The wife absolutely loves their fresh hamburgers. Their BBQ flatbread pizza is delicious also. It's a very popular restaurant so expect a wait. It'll be well worth it.

I demanded a "no chain" place for dinner. My dad requested something light. My mom...well, she wasn't picky.   So my brother, SIL and a couple other locals suggested we go here. Had I not pigged out earlier in the day, I would have ordered one of the burger or sandwich options. Instead, I ordered the BBQ chicken salad minus the dressing. For something I was expecting a side salad size, it was a big size bowl full of greens (spinach, arugula and romaine lettuce mix), BBQ chicken pieces, some corn, and tortilla chip strips. I loved everything about it but unfortunately couldn't finish. I stole a handful of my dad's hot and crunchy sweet potato fries. My mom liked her BBQ chicken pizza but there was just too much of it to finish. And she can eat for a tiny person. The wait wasn't terrible but get in defense mode when scoping out a table on a crowded night. It's at least a four person place: 2 to wait in line, order, and carry/manage the food, while the other 2 eyeball where the next empty table will pop up. And break....
Grilled Buffalo Chicken sandwich rocks. Kids loved the Grilled Cheese as well.
Fun to find this gem in the midst of sprawling Phoenix (thanks Drive-Ins, Diners and Dives!).  Fontina burger was great! Nice story behind the place, too.  Makes you feel instantly connected to it.

Great food experience!  Visited recently to a great menu in a farm atmosphere.  Indoor or outdoor dining.  Met or exceeded my expectations for a delectable lunch.  Get there early as the line get's busy about Noon.  Other businesses on the farm including a great microbrewery called 12 West Brewing.com.  Taking all my peeps there for lunch and a beer hop next week.  Unlike any other dining experience I have experienced and the food was GREAT!

This is our first review after a few visits to Joe's. Every time food has been pretty exceptional. However, the only disappointing thing is both times I came for the portobello mushroom sandwich they were out of mushrooms. The grilled ahi tuna is fantastic and I would highly recommend it.

What an excellent surprise! Just needed a place for a bite to eat and an impromptu family reunion and ended up in the perfect spot. Smack in the middle of the desert and lo and behold there's a farm and picnic tables, green grass and autumn leaves falling off trees that you can stomp in and crunch. Of course it was the day after Christmas but in Arizona the weather is always full of wonderful twists.  It's definitely a Farmstand concept with a bit of a modern twist. Reminded me of the roadside farm restaurants back east. The menu is large and filled with old and new favorites, all made with fresh ingredients. I had a burger that while perhaps a little on the done side, tasted fabulous. You know it'll be good when you see the perfectly misshapen form! The buttery roll is always a plus. Everybody was able to satisfy their cravings from a beet salad to veggie burgers to peanut butter and banana sandwiches. And since we were able to eat outdoors, even with a pretty gusty wind blowing, we could have conversations and really enjoy our family gathering without the noise level you find indoors. The grill for pizza was out of service, so we didn't get to try it but I'm pretty sure they'll be a return trip.

My favorite place to meet up with friends for lunch or grab a burger for take out. I've never had a bad meal from here. I love the outdoor areas where you can dine and hang out with friends. You can take a stroll through the community garden too and check out the new Barnone crafters mall.
We order some appetizers and some desserts. The food looks like it was prepared somewhere else. I thought it was overpriced.

Loved the atmosphere.  Didn't care for the very long line.   Food was good, but not great.  I had the Fontina burger and onion rings along with coleslaw.  My daughter had corndogs with fries and and my wife had a garden burger.  For desert my wife had a dark chocolate shake and I had the vanilla bean shake.  I'll try the coffee shake next time.  Update:  I went again and had a pepperoni pizza...meh.  OMG, you have to come to checkout the insane bathroom here.  #creepybarbiebathroom   Update2:  Went after the big remodel for breakfast.  Food was good.  Wish they would have updated their scary bathrooms.  See this video if you don't know what I'm referring to-- https://youtu.be/78Yj3QPGEyU

I always feel so good when I eat here! Fresh food, and a wonderful atmosphere, I love getting the peanut butter, chocolate chip, banana sandwich thing and sitting outside and feeding my crust to the birds. DInner and a show! The iced tea is pretty good as well.   The only problem with this place is the line is sometimes so long because of how great it is!! :P

I came here with a few friends and my family the service was good and we got there just in time because there was line behind us that formed out of the door. The menu was simple and easy to read. The food was pretty pricey for what you got. For a kids meal and two buffalo chicken sandwiches we paid around 35 bucks for it. The food was ok the French fries were drenched in salt and the chicken we got with the kids meal was terrible my kids would not even eat it, there was no seasoning, no flavor and it was dry I would give this place another chance  just because of the atmosphere it had a good old school feel to it and if you sat outside it is pretty open to where the kids could run around.
Great American food with fresh ingredients. Wonderful place to take the kids with tons of space to run around and plenty of kid friendly menu choices.
I love Joe's. They have an amazing atmosphere with super friendly and knowledgeable staff. Every time I go there I have a great time! Keep it up Joe's!

I love this place. Anytime friends or family come to town they all favor this place. The food is the best, definitely quality you can taste.  I recently had the best service ever with a worker there Nannette!  This place keeps getting better!  I love the shrimp platter with onion rings. The cheesecake is out of this world!

I took my niece here for lunch on my sister in law's recommendation.  They grow the produce right there on the farm.  You can walk around and literally see where your food comes from.  I had the fried shrimp which is a treat for me.  They were awesome.  Flavorful breading.  We had sweet potato fries (served with incredible pineapple salsa)which even tasted good the next day cold at the airport with the seared ahi to go that was cheaper and a million times better than airport food.  Katrina had the portobello mushroom burger.  I had some and it was cooked & dressed perfectly.  The coleslaw was fresh & tasty, the fried zucchini were excellent.  The portions were so huge we could only eat about one third.  There is outside seating under the mister & I will be going back.

Excellent selection, One of the best bbq chicken pizzas I've ever tasted,  Delicious fried green beans, Very friendly bunch of kids they have working there.. They just have to do something about the flies. There were hundreds of them. They'll eat your food if you're not careful.  My grandma almost went Super Saiyan on the dang things! Don't take a date or your grandma here, get takeout instead. They have a picture of Guy Fieri on the wall and even he's swattin them flies away.

Delicious food! My favorite is the farm burger with a side of onion rings. The BBQ chicken pizza is great, too. Lines are long but staff is efficient enough that the wait isn't too bad. The tasty food is made to order and ambience is pretty cool.

Excellent food, everything tasted great.    I had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich & Garlic fries.  They use only hormone-free, natural grain fed chickens, which is maybe why the meat was so tender.  Tossed in hot wing sauce, bleu cheese and some nicely cut celery, it was like eating hot wings in a sandwich.  And it wasn't just quickly slapped together and tossed down the line, these guys took their time.  Also, I'm a big fan of iced tea, and whatever it is they're using here is superior to most.  I was a little annoyed at first paying $14 for a chicken sandwich & fries; but when I sat down and ate it, I felt like I really got what I paid for...a damn good chicken sandwich.  I will most likely return to try other things on the menu.

I go here for lunch sometimes and I always have a great experience. The food is amazing and it's a fun environment . It's something different and unique. They have picnic tables outside with large trees that provide lots of shade. Also, I love their Sweet Potato fries!

This is the best place for a quiet and peaceful meal. The setting is under big trees and you can choose to sit inside or outside. Great meeting place for the ability to share with each other in a calm and pretty setting. The food is amazing and the grounds and gardens are such a great addition.

Excellent food and well worth the wait in line. The food was very tasty. Plenty of unique options on menu to order. There is both indoor and outdoor eating options. More room outside on picnic benches. Very reasonable prices and good food. We will be back.

I come to Arizona at least once a year and every time I go visit Joe's Farm Grill; I always get stares from the customers and sometimes the staff. Maybe its because I'm a small Asian girl who goes in with a white friend (not trying to be racist at all) who's about.. 6'3 and I'm only 5'0, and a group of other interracial people, but ya know, I guess it was bound to happen.   We walked in during the night time and it wasn't crazy busy. Hot but not crazy busy. We ordered the Fontana Burger, Onion Rings, Garlic Fries, BBQ Chicken Pizza and two chocolate shakes. Bill came out to be around.. $50ish I believe.. or even higher than that--I can't recall. I had high expectations of this place for the food Guy Feiri had and said about them. Boy, I was deceived.   The Fontana Burger we had was dry and tasted bitter. I loved the fact that they kept saying their veggies were grown fresh and yes, I love that but I don't think it went well with the burger, especially for its cost. The onion rings were large and crispy but the inside was raw and when I bit into it the onion came right out. Batter still intact but the onion came straight out. Garlic fries were amazingly good yet still extremely oily from its cooking process. The Chocolate shakes were too very very delicious, rich chocolatey taste not too thick not too viscous with a nice little hint of bitterness in its after taste. The BBQ Chicken Pizza was the only entree that kept it's hype from DDD; moist, full of flavour and an orgasm in your mouth. Was truly delicious now only if I could add some sort of hot sauce on it to give it a spicy taste. I always keep coming back to this restaurant because its just one of those restaurants you hope to get better every time you go visit. It stayed relatively the same.  I sometimes doubt what Guy Feri says about certain restaurants sometimes its either a hit or miss. But if you're ever in the area and aren't on a serious budget give this place a try. This place might not be for me but it might be for you.

Decided to try this place based on the food network raves.  Ordered various items, including BBQ pizza, BBQ pork plate, portabella mushroom sandwich.  Also did the Peanut butter bananna split just to say we tried it.  Nothing really jumped out as being above average.  Pork was average, sandwich average and pizza was as well.  The pb&bananna split was not good AT ALL.  It was mostly the thick texas toast, and very greasy.  (we got it to split for dessert)  The only thing that was really better than average was the fried zuchinni.  The breading was light and flavorful and they were not at all greasy.   The parking was bad, but the atmosphere was kind of cute.  Different than any place I'd been before.   All in all, if you don't live in that part of town, I wouldn't make a special trip.

I've been here probably a dozen times. When I'm craving the perfect, juiciest burger, I drive half an hour a way here and I'm never disappointed. Everyone is always so friendly and seems genuinely happy even at the busiest times. I have Celiac Disease so I have to be really careful about gluten and cross contamination. They actually have a gluten free fryer (whoop whoop) and they always tells they will do the best they can to avoid cross contamination. I've never been glutened there so I'm very thankful for this! In short, it's one of those places that I'd be surprised you had a bad experience. You might wait a bit in line but I just avoid busy hours. Afterwards, we always walk over and get coffee from The Coffee Shop. It's just a perfect day for me.
Freaky great casual atmosphere!  And don't miss the bakery next door. Great outdoor and indoor seating, we plan to go back for breakfast with the dogs!

Perfect for family gatherings or date night! Our meal isn't complete here without an order of the garlic fries YUM! We have not had an item on the menu that isn't delicious, but we highly recommend the BBQ sampler! Love this place and has friendly customer service!
Funny my burger didn't look like the add pics it was bright red inside. Scary for a hamburger. Will not be going back,and the line to order is slower than Disneyland.

Not entirely impressed. My fiancé got the the buffalo chicken sandwich and I got the pulled bbq pork sandwich nothing but fat. Waited quite a bit of time to get my greek? Fries( cant remember what kind they were) after my meal but when I did I found a hair in my food. When i approached the cashier she was apologetic but when she gave me my money back she was still wear the gloves she was handling food in.. Ew

I constantly rave about this place to my friends. Usually what gets them going is the fact that I mention that this place was on Food Network. I remember seeing the show and being very interested in trying it since it was nearby. My favorite thing about this place is of course the food. It is all grown on their farm and if it isn't, it is locally grown and organic. The food wows my every time. I love it. My all time favorites are the Ahi Tuna Sandwich, the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich, and fried green beans (although I no longer see it on the menu, which saddens me). I have also had their burgers and I can seriously tell the difference between their beef and beef from other restaurants. To explain how I can tell the difference, my family bought a cow years ago and had it cut up to produce various selections that we split with another family. To me, a lot of beef tastes disgusting except for what I buy straight from a butcher AND from Joes Farm Grill. That alone is my reasoning for instantly loving this place. Joes Farm Grill has many different food selections to choose from and I suggest trying all of them. All are very delicious in their own right.

I've eaten here three times over the last couple of years.  I had always wanted to try it, since I frequented Joe's BBQ, but it's so far out, that I never found myself in the area.  I went there once with a friend from out of town who saw it on TV and had to go there, so we made the trip.  I had a bacon cheeseburger, some garlic fries and a drink.  It took a while to get the food, which is fine since that way you know it's fresh.  I was really looking forward to the garlic fries, as it's one of the things I love about Gordon Biersch, so I wanted to see their take on them.  Once we got the food, we actually were fortunate enough to get a table inside (this was in June).  I was disappointed that they didn't have fresh lemonade like Joe's BBQ.  They had that 0% juice Minute Maid stuff.  Then no Dr. Pepper!  I am surprised that for the money they charge for a small drink, you get the totally basic Coke fountain with Mr. Pibb.  The burger was good, but nothing to write home about. It was fresh, the cheese had good flavor and the bacon was good.  It was the best part of the meal, which was unfortunate because the garlic fries should have taken the cake, but were so loaded up with oil that they weren't that enjoyable.  I don't know how to describe the feeling, but once you get about 3/4 through them, you end up with a soup of sorts and it's tough to finish them.    I was hoping that it would be different the next time, but they're consistent.  I won't say no to it if I'm in the area and someone wants to eat there, but it's not good enough to make the drive from where I live in Central Phoenix.  I'll take Joe's BBQ first.  It's actually cheaper for more food.

Fast service on our order...we called ahead and it was ready to go when we got there 5 minutes later. Free wifi. while you wait. Got the salad with chicken on top and onion rings. **Krunchy** onion rings!

First stop coming from San Diego,CA! The line was long but don't let it stop you from trying their delicious food! I ordered the ahi tuna sandwhich with a side of their GARLIC Fries. Both were delicious!! My boyfriend got their goat cheese stuff lamb burger with a side of Greek fries and was also very good! Definitely recommend this place. They have a variety of fountain drinks, milkshakes and lemonades! Lots of indoor and outdoor seating. Great customer service!!! Definitely will come back again.

Really cool concept- they use local ingredients (some picked right outside of their front door). We went for breakfast and had the a) meat and potatoes and b) chicken and mushroom scrambles. These were BIG portions, so bring your appetite.

They gave us $10 off because it's my birthday! Went for breakfast. Loved the setting. Lots of outdoor seating under big trees. The bacon & sausage are really good. Def get their apple fritters! My waffle was ok. Husband liked their potatoes. We want to go back for lunch/dinner.

The concept is really cool, but the food was pretty average.  Joe's was highly recommended by friends.  We got there about 6:30pm on Monday.  The line was long, so we had a chance to review the menu and history.  When we got to the window and started ordering, they then told us they were out of most everything except burgers, grilled chicken & fries So, that's what we ordered.   There was no pizza, no BBQ, no onion rings, etc.)  Wish the would have told us while we waited.  Heck, they had fancy TV monitors promoting their products while we stood in line.  Why not tell us the update before getting to the window!?!  And, it was just OK... basic grilled chicken either on a bun or on-top of a salad.  The dressings were nothing to write home about.  The menu promised greens from their farm.  Well, sorry to say, I've grown & purchased local, farm fresh greens and Joe's tasted pretty mass-produced and bland.  My biggest concern would be that we arrived OFF season and waited at least 30 minutes to order and they were sold out of half of the menu.  I shudder to think what it would be like when the whole garden is full (meaning 4x more crowds than last night.)  Go for the concept, but be prepared for a long wait for basic food.

I drove all across town just to get one of their hot dogs. When I got there they were out at 1 in the afternoon. So I settled for a pork tenderloin sandwich. It was seriously the worst I've ever had. Dry and tasteless. 5 years ago this place rocked, lately every time I come here I'm let down. Have they changed owners?
Such a great place to take the family. Love the outdoor seating and fun bathroom :) I just wish they had more options for people food allergies/celiac, other than that it's great!

Lousy service, food is ok IF they have what you want.  I showed up today, wooed to go here by the description of the Ham & Cheese fritters.  So, arriving 10 minutes after they opened at 8 - they were out.  No "sorry" - just "we don't have it, but it's on the list to be made."  Good to know.    Maybe one of the two cooks on break or the cook who kept running back and forth to the bathroom texting on could have made some.  I got something else (only because the counter girl made me feel uncomfortable, becuase I was taking too long thinking about a plan B) - it was ok.  Service was mediocre - counter girl just set on our empty drink cups on the counter, forcing us to reach inside their stupid window while she watched.  The maintenance guy (after a good 30 minute BS session with another maintenance guy) proceeded to stink up the outside (how hard is to stink up the outside?) using ridiculous amounts of stainless steel polish.    I was visiting friends, who said they don't go becuase it is always crowded. Every time we drove by this week, the parking lot was empty.  10 minutes after open - you are already out of stuff for the after-church breakfast crowd - now I see why.  Most TV stars make it becuase they are great actors - this TV star acts like a great restaurant - but really - I would pass.  Stick to farming, Joe.  EDIT - I was contacted by their General Manager within hours of this review being posted.  That is some quick response, and he seemed genuine in making things right.  It does not change what the visit was like, but I will give them another star for the effort to fix things so quickly.

Came here for dinner ordered a BBQ pork sandwich with a side of slaw .. every time ive came it hasnt been bad but today they decided to serve COLD BBQ pork .. no exaggeration but the plate was hotter than the meat was.. great service ! Poor food quality .

It's a ways out there, but worth the drive. Very family friendly. We went on a Saturday and were dismayed by the very long Disney-esque lines at lunch, but we had driven so far...! My BF had the Chicken Caesar salad and I had a salad with ahi. We shared some fries. All of the food was done really well and there's no denying the produce is just-picked and wonderful. The outdoors seating is really nice if the weather's cooperating.
Foods good, but it's lunch rush and you have one window open taking orders while you have a line of people going out your doors...... why??
Good food - the wait to order seems to need a little improvement. I understand speed of service and keeping the kitchen on time, just a long wait to order.

Came across Joe's Farm Grill during a work trip to Gilbert. I was impressed by the amount of great views and not to mention Guy Fieri approved! This place can be somewhat difficult to find as the building is surrounded by trees. What first appeared as a line out the door, quickly was shorten as the service is fast here. Menus are strategically placed before you enter the front door so you can view the selection as you wait in line. Staff member went around greeting everyone and asking if everyone was good. Appreciated that their staff immediately cleaned down tables as soon as parties left.   Plenty of seating both indoor and outdoor. Great for big groups. Loved the picnic tables underneath the trees. Both kid and pet friendly environment. Also, very interesting unisex bathroom! Dolls displayed behind a case and a tv in front of the men's stall! Only thing I wish they would fix is the amount of flies both inside and outside. =[ I initially sat outside to enjoy the scenery, but was quickly turned off by all the flies. I thought by moving inside I would escape the flies, but I was wrong. There were not as many flies as outside but was really annoyed that i had to constantly hover my hand over my food to deter the flies.   Fontina Burger ($9.99) was point. Perfect amount of crisp on the bun, tasty patty, and generous amount of pesto. The sweet potato fries (extra $2.50 charge) were great and included a sweet tasting dipping sauce that completed well. The fresh strawberry lemonade ($3.99) is enough for two people to share.    Tip: Make sure to grab napkins before you sit down. There are no napkin dispensers on the tables.
This is a great place to eat for someone out in the east valley. Good food but there always seems to be lines here. I guess that's a sign of good food but I would avoid this on a Friday evening.

I first heard about this place from my dad in Arlington, Tx. He had seen an episode of Diner's, Drive Ins, and Dives, and thought the food looked really good. Since my brother was in town, I thought going to eat here would be something to do in my dad's memory. I had also seen the Diner's, Drive Ins, and Dives show about this place and thought it looked worth a try. After reading some of the reviews I must say I believe they are buying into some of the hype created by the aforementioned show. We went around noon, so we expected it to be busy, but the line to order was like standing in line waiting to board an amusement ride, as you circle through metal line dividers. You grab your menus from a menu holder up by the window. You figure this out on your own by the way. So after about a 20 minute wait, we get to the window. The woman taking our order could have cared less. Her hair was long (past her shoulders) and not tied back, or clipped up which I think isn't a good idea working around all that food. She was obviously not having a good day and got the order wrong. I didn't realize the order was wrong until we were outside at the fountain drink place. Thankfully my daughter went back inside to clarify the order. There was another line at the fountain drinks/condiments area, but again, it was lunch time. They give you a beeper that signals when your food was ready. Our beeper went off, we gathered our food, and went to sit inside. There were plenty of people sitting outside, but being that it's June in Arizona, inside felt a lot better. This was especially true for my brother visiting from Seattle. He had almost melted in Texas due to the humidity, lol. My daughter had the grilled cheese, and sweet potato fries. She liked them both. My brother had the farm burger, and I ordered the barbecue chicken pizza. We ordered garlic fries, and onion rings on the side for all of us to sample. The pizza was ok. Granted I expected it to be phenomenal after watching the TV show, but it was just ok. The garlic fries, and onion rings were good. My brother said the farm burger was good as well. Now, the dark chocolate shake was heavenly! I ordered one of these as my dad loved chocolate shakes. He would have loved it. It is a cute place to eat as it's has such a retro feel to it, but the line was something my dad would not have enjoyed. After looking at some of the pics reviewing this restaurant, and reading the reviews, I think breakfast here looks really worth a try. The food is good but the experience was a little lacking. FOLLOW UP-ALL IS GOOD. Truly a business shouldn't  be judged by one less than stellar experience. I still haven't tried breakfast yet but plan to do so soon. Joe's Farm Grill is a breath of fresh air and originality in a world of chain franchises.

Like Joe needs another review... My two cents are: we ate here twice in three days. In the land of Yelping that says it all.  There are millions of restaurants to try on vacation and why go back to the same one? Because every single person in our party of four LOVED it.  This place can handle a crowd.  Don't let the line out the door scare you. It moves quickly and is also a sign of the goodness to be had here.  My recommendations: sweet potato fries OR the sweet potato pie. Do not get both on the same trip. (The fries taste sweeter than the pie if you do that.) Both are insanely good. The pie is veggielicious. You can tell they mashed those taters from Joe's garden today! The Fontina burger also is "the best burger I ever had" and he got it on both our trips there. :)  We liked sitting outside both times. We got to meet exotic birds on our Sunday lunch trip. A man had brought several different species.  Macaw "Buddy" gave me a kiss!  Memory- Priceless!
Very delicious place. It can get really packed and they only had one cashier working so the line moved slowly. The food was delicious and has a good vibe to it

Great place! Good food, the outdoor seating is so nice and kid friendly. I love their green eggs and ham and their breakfast tacos are yummy. Also love their pancakes.  We usually never find seating so we always bring a picnic mat because you will always find a shady spot on the grass picnic style! Only problem is there are a lot of dogs! We went there for mother's day and a party showed up with 10+ dogs and one of them came and stuck his mouth in my plate. They also barked up the place and it was a bit annoying considering we were sitting on the grass. Needless to say they were peeing everywhere just arms reach of our food. I think Joe's should have a limitation on how many pets you can bring. Don't get me wrong i looove dogs and cats but sometimes it's just too much. turns into a petting zoo. Great for kids and i have a 20 month old daughter but just for sanitary reasons there should a sign that ratio of humans to animals should be at least 2 to 1  Otherwise i love this place and the food.

Loved this place. Beautiful scenery, calming atmosphere, tons of outdoor seating. My bbq chicken salad was great and the sweet pt fries were delicious. It was very crowded on a Tuesday during lunch time, which I was not expecting. We got there at 12:30 and waited a half hour in line. By 1:30 the line had died down completely. I would recommend not coming during peak lunch time unless you're ok with the long wait. I loved sitting outside, especially with the orange trees blossoming. Smelled amazing!
I love their black bean burger. So good. Sweet potato fries are a few extra bucks, but worth it.
This place was phenomenal! The service was fantastic, enjoyed our lunch so much that we are going back for dinner! Strongly recommend the new Gouda Garlic Bacon Burger Stack!

MMMmmmmmm...what isn't to love about this place!!!! a MUST VISIT for any local or a local with out of town guests.  ANything you order will please you - promise.  (oh - and check out the bathrooms - very cool)
Not sure what the big deal is. It's regular fast food. My ribs came out cold inside (twice). Fires and onion rings weren't fresh. The rest of the items were meh. First and last time here.

Joes is a favorite of ours.  It's always good food with a homegrown menu and that farm raised feeling.  I've never had a bad meal here.  It's definitely not fine dining being out on picnic tables but it's also pretty reasonable in price.  We stop by regularly.

Been to Joe's several times and last time out it was like the rest fantastic.  It's typically busy so don't let that scare you off.  Food is great.  You can't go wrong from breakfast lunch or dinner choices.  Best outside seating in the valley with the picnic tables and the enormous trees.  Worth your time for sure and don't forget the apple fritters

I've run the gamut on onion rings... from two days ago experiencing the worst at Pete's, to today experiencing the best at Joe's.  These people were on their A-game tonight. The pulled pork & baby backs had such a flavorful smokey essence, while the chicken strips were an amazing taste combination between chicken parm and BBQ sauce.  Did I mention they have the best onion rings ever?  A great example of a restaurant that doesn't skimp, rather display an eye for detail. It takes more prep time, but it's worth it, and it shows.  The shrimp basket was very good, and the homemade cocktail sauce was the crowning jewel.  What's better than a surry with a fringe on top?  Howz about a hot dog with an egg on top.  Delectable!

Fresh and delicious. The beet salad was uniquely wonderful taste. Sandwiches and cheese pairings wonderful. Large portions so you can share. Very busy, so be prepared for a long line.   There is a gluten free bun on the menu, however they were out of stock on the day we were there.

Haven't been here in a few years but met a friend there for lunch & went to the coffee shop for the first time. I wanted breakfast & they serve till noon where as the other part serves breakfast till 11:00. It was so yummy! Had The Mediterranean scramble. It was delicious with a nice fresh salad on the side. The ice coffee was great. Going back more often even though I live in Chandler & it's not that close. But worth it!

This time of year is perfect for joes farm grill  The place is perfect to eat outside  Perfect for family with small children  The food is so good , we had their garlic fries They are so good, salmon salad, and a delicious burger And the weather is perfect !

Yummy! Check out the 4B burger, onion rings, and a milk shake if your waistline is up to it! The BBQ chicken pizza or Carolina Dog is nice change of pace if you've sampled the rest of their menu. Note the homemade pickles! They have panko-breaded chicken tenders, too at a really good price.  If you're tempted by the ribs, I'd recommend getting them at Joe's Real BBQ instead. Good stuff.

Went today. Not very busy and still took about 15 mins to get 2 burgers and a shake. The reason is because our burgers were done but they were doing TRAINING so our burgers sat there while the one server went through all of the procedure to adding pickles, lettuce etc, all the garnishments. That alone took a good 5 mins. Meanwhile our burger sat there getting cold. Also the fries.  Then they called us up, I alreayd knew it was going to be cold because we saw how long it had been sitting out with 2 employees hovering over it.  Burgers were cold, fries were cold. Had to send it all back. UNREAL!!!!  I have been to Joes at LEAST 20x since its in our neighborhood and our last 5 experiences have been HORRIBLE.  So disappointing. This place used to be great!
Visited this restaurant several times.  It's a counter-order place, just so you know what it is before you get there.  Food has always been outstanding, unique, and TASTY! Love it!

Main Points: -Great casual fare for breakfast, lunch, or dinner -Unique venue, fun to bring visitors  Review: I'm giving this place 5 stars, because in the category of casual food, this place is great! They have some tasty burgers and flatbread pizza that'll leave you full, garlic fries that are totally addicting, and delightful shakes.    My absolute favorite menu pick to get at Joe's is their waffles and ribs on their breakfast menu.  I'm not even a waffle person but their waffles are perfection, lightly crispy on the outside and salty sweet.  Add ribs on top, and it's pure deliciousness in your mouth!   Finally, the venue itself is a fun atmosphere with picnic tables amongst the shade trees, plenty of grassy area for kids to enjoy, and quirky bathrooms. Note that if it's too hot/cold outside, there is inside seating as well. Just be aware that when there's great weather, lines can get  long but they seem to move pretty fast and you can always call your order in for pick-up. If great tasting casual fare is what you're looking for, then Joe's Farm Grill won't disappoint!

Breakfast is awesome! I tried the 3B (buttermilk, blue cheese, bacon) pancakes the other day. Very interesting! Love all the fries! The ahi tuna sandwich or the pesto chicken sandwich are to die for...Stop over at the coffee shop next door for a cupcake.
We love the food, both breakfast and lunch/ dinner menus never disappoint! But try the coconut soda - you're welcome.

OK,, there are a few items to "grade" here...  Location. 5* .. The locations and outdoor seating are is very nice for AZ desert. .. Definitely a plus. Cleanliness. 5* .. Very clean and kept clean even during busy traffic times. Staff. 5* Very nice and knowledgeable staff ready to help and answer questions .. Now down to the food. 4*.  BBQ Pork plate. Pork was pretty good, and above average for flavoring, not directly needing additional sauces to be added, served with a garlic "bread" more like a fat tortilla, (not a fan of the bread), side Cole slaw was , fresh, but ehhh as far as taste.. I would do the Pork again..  Sonoran Dog. Split bread grilled dog in some beans n cheese, etc,, now here's an 8 dollar dog.. or was it 9?.. but definitely very good and would prefer that over the bbq pork. Side Onion Rings,,ok, one of the best items i tried here, and possibly will be one of the most memorable onion rings I've had in a long time.   Will i be back? that depends if the patrons here are the same at all times.. There were 4 different families not watching their kids like it was a playground, one of which blowing on a survival type whistle,, wth..

Be careful with substitutions.  Substitutions: Not a fan of how they up charge vegetarians. Most places don't charge extra for a vegetarian substitution. If you take a non-veggie burger here like the Fontina Burger and substitute for the veggie patty, you pay $2 more.  The fact that this happened on my birthday made it all the worse. There were a number of vegetarians in our group.   Food: The veggie burger was typical. Garlic fries were good and quite garlicky. Onion rings were good and had a subtle hint of dill flavor.   Not sure if we will be back given the extra charges for vegetarians.

Don't let the long lines or a couple of one star reviews deter you from trying Joe's Farm Grill in Gilbert.  I went there upon a friend's recommendation and I'm glad I went. I got there about noon and there was already a line out the door. Initially there was only one cashier taking orders but then another cashier line opened and the line went a lot faster.  We only waited about fifteen minutes which gave my friend and I enough time to peruse over the extensive varied menu. You can choose from burgers, salads, pizza, chicken and grilled cheese sandwiches and also milkshakes.  The cashier who took our order was very warm, friendly and welcoming. We ordered the farm chicken sandwich with bacon and grilled onions on multi grain toast with a side caesar salad and it was wonderful. My friend had the grilled vegetable pizza and she also loved it and ate the entire pizza even though she is a petite woman. We shared a chocolate milkshake.  There is plenty of seating indoors and outside. We also thought that the prices were very reasonable considering the high quality of the food. Our bill came to about $ 25.00 and we left very satisfied.
Great food and even better desserts. Prices are reasonable and food portions are the perfect size. They find the seats for you so no need to worry about the long lines.
Good for and friendly folks, reasonable prices and a great location in the little organic farm area.  Great farmers market across from them also.

Brought my wife here for her birthday brunch and we got 10 dollars off her meal. I got the breakfast tacos and coming from south Texas I was a little skeptical about how good they could be but I was quite impressed! It was reasonably priced, too. Pleasant atmosphere with a lot of covered outdoor seating. We will definitely be coming back.

So I'm apparently oblivious to the fact that anything with the name Joe is owned by the same person.  Luckily for me, I wasn't stupid enough to order bbq pork again.  Joe's Farm Grill is a pretty cool concept and probably the only decent place to eat on this side of the 202 (since Mobsters INC closed, at least).  There are enough review here that clearly he is doing something right.  Suburbanites love to feel like they don't live in a city and, I'm sure, love the idea of a restaurant with picnic tables and trees.  They must because the place was a freaking day care when we went, with snotty brats running all around and climbing on everything.  Anyways, back to the food.  I ordered a BBQ Bacon Burger.  I didn't bother to specify how I wanted it cooked and it was, surprisingly, cooked to a decent medium-well.  I subbed some sweet potato fries with it and they were pretty good.  Little more pepper would have made them great but oh well.  The wife had wanted to sub the veggie fries with hers but they made us order a side of them.  That side was literally 3 pounds of fried veggies and was way too much for any human to consume.  They weren't really my thing but the wife enjoyed.  This place does a lot of things well but they suffer from a lot of the logistical problems that Joe's BBQ does.  The line is better and it keeps people from getting backed up but they seem to run out of menus quickly.  People grab them, carry them in line, and leave them at the window.  As a result, there are no menus left when people walk in.  I refilled the thing twice while I was standing in line.  Also, the condiment/drink counter is outside and all in a row right by the door into the restaurant.  These weird clusters of people trying to get a drink or some sauce develop and creates an obstacle course for people going in and out of the restaurant.  This leads me to my final problem - the indoor pickup window.  While the summer is long and hot (and I'm sure leads to a lot of people usually sitting inside), the day we went had tons of people sitting outside.  When their buzzers went off, they had to go inside to pickup the food.  The single door seemed to be all sorts of hazardous for people going in to get food and people coming out with food.  Finally, and I know this sounds stupid, but the trash can outside has the smallest opening ever.  You cannot actually stick your plastic basket inside the trash can and turn it over to dump your food out.  You have to pick the stuff up out of the basket and throw it away with your hands.  I just finished my meal, cleaned my hands, and now I have to wash them again because I had to handle a greasy, sauce-covered piece of paper to throw it away.  I know this sounds nitpicky but it turned what would normally be a 4-star peaceful lunchtime experience into a logistically stressful nightmare for me.  When you make it hard for me to get in and out with my food, it makes me feel like you don't want me there.  I know they are going to read this and I know they are going to dismiss it just like my gripes about Joe's BBQ but do me a favor, when you build your next restaurant, hire someone with a degree in urban planning to help with the layout instead of just cramming things wherever you think they will fit.

I am a fan of this place, yeah...I am. I come here from time to time when I want something different and simple. I've been coming here more for the breakfast than the lunch/dinner with my hubby when we want to just have a nice moment to ourselves and eating outside to enjoy the time underneath the big old trees. I really enjoy their coffee, though sometimes it's a pain to wait for the only carafe available at one time. A suggestion would be to put out some kind of coffee bar like they do with the condiments bar and fountain drinks area (and have more than one carafe of reg/decaf out). MUST COME AS EARLY AS YOU CAN because the lines will be outrageous, especially on the weekends!  Their fresh fruit garnishments are fresh and delicious and I do like the taste of their syrup and Belgian waffles. I'm not a fan of the piece of flatbread they put on the side when you order the meat and potato scramble because it's really just that - flat, but not tasty. I think it's out of place with the rest of the meal. My hubby likes the waffles and fruit (as do I) and the Joe's Big Breakfast. He likes his breakfast with a variety on the plate. Oh! I forgot to mention that the other breakfast I enjoy is the Chicken and Mushroom Scramble - totally fresh and delicious! Since I mentioned the kiddos, they really enjoy the chicken tenders...not greasy, they're flavorful and super super fresh!  The prices are a little steep when it comes to the food and the size of the portions (except for Joe's Big Breakfast), but it's farm fresh and I'm okay to spend just a little bit more when it's just me and the hubby. If I wanted the gluttony and bring the kids along, we'll go to Black Bear Diner to satisfy the portions and prices which we enjoy very much. But I'll definitely still keep coming around here...

This is one of my facorite places to eat in the ENTIRE valley. The location is inconvenient for me as I live in the Biltmore area but I can't resist. Everything is so fresh and clean and the atmosphere is warm and inviting and very family (and pet) friendly as there is ample outdoor seating. This is a feel good place with the nicest workers. Your food is done in a reasonable amount of time and it never dissapoints. They know what they are doing. They need to open another location... perhaps on the west side. It would do great. The lines are ALWAYS long but trust me.. it is totally worth it.

The only complaint I have is that the lines can be really long at times, but it's always been worth waiting for the food.    I'm loving all the food, morning, noon and night! Can't go wrong. The food is fresh and different. I definite place to add to your places to eat on a regular basis. It's great to take someone for the first time to let them experience AZ in a different way.    The food is so good, it is delivered in a casual atmosphere you have the choice of eating indoors in what used to be the living room of this farm or outdoors in a patio setting or under the trees on picnic tables. This place is good for young families.  Oh you have to visit the restroom, it's a bit entertaining!  LOL!  Check it out, and let the world find out what  you think!

This place is great. I've had a bunch of different menu items and each one is worth reordering. The garlic fries are great. In the winter time they have really pretty out door seating, there are nice areas to sit around, and a large tree for kids to climb. There isn't anything too faulty about this place but nothing that merits a 5 start rating. But it's one of those unique spots the are great for out of towners, and it never hurts to mention it was on TV.

We love Joe's Farm Grill!! I've had the Fontina Burger twice now and it is delicious! I love sitting outside under the big trees. There is a fun feeling about this place. The fries here are not my favorite, so I like to get a side Caesar salad instead at no charge!

i finally made out to Joe's farm grill for the first time today.  we both have been eating healthy at home for the last couple of weeks and decided to treat ourselves today! we both ordered the farm burger and the sweet potatoes fries and we shared some onion rings...oh my, these bad boys are crazy unhealthy for you but so good.  this place did live up to the hype and the burgers were both tasty and fresh. give it a try if you are in the mood for gourmet fast food.

The atmosphere is really cool, but the food is mediocre. I ordered the veggie pizza and friend got the BBQ platter with garlic fries. The best thing was the garlic fries. The pizza wasn't good and the BBQ was average. Next time I think I'll try a burger with the garlic fries.

Diamond in the 'burbs! This place is a great experience.  They incorporate great architecture, great restaurant technology, great variety of indoor/outdoor seating areas and the food is WONDERFUL! If you haven't already gone here, GO! And try the coffee shop, too!
This place has awesome food, in a casual setting.  The only thing disappointing would be the flies.  They were everywhere while we were trying to eat dinner.

Great great great place for kids! They get to run around while you enjoy a relaxing and delicious meal. The food is fresh and tasty. The menu has a lot of options for everyone, and the food is just overall fantastic! The service is fast and friendly. And sometimes they hold family friendly activities there. I highly recommend this place!
Really great food. Love the atmosphere. It's a perfect place to go to get the family together and go for a quality breakfast or brunch! I really like the outdoor setting and location.

Last night I went with my motorcycle club out to Joe's for dinner.  It was really out on a farm.  This place is very far but the experience was worth the drive.    I ordered the Fontina Burger that had roasted red peppers, grilled mushrooms, arugula, pesto, and fontina cheese.  The ingredients were fresh as they grow their own vegetables on the farm right there.  The fries that came with it were cooked well and very good as well.    There is room to eat inside at a community table or your own table and there is a huge area outside to eat on benches as well.  Overall it was a great experience and I will go back because there are several other things on the menu that looked very appetizing.
Very different building. Cool vibe. Food was good but pricey for what you get.
This is one of my favorite lunch places as a vegetarian! I order the veggie burger and sweet potatoes fries  and am never disappointed.
Delicious and simple! The wait can be a little long at times but it's worth it.
The great thing about Joe's is that even though they were busy - and they were busy - they were still helpful and the food was good and the service was great. What's not to like?

I've only been once and it was in the middle of a remodel, but i wasn't impressed.  Besides the ambiance, I wasn't impressed. I thought it was more of a sit down restaurant, not a place with food on a paper plate.
Great food! Love this place. Love sitting outside, when cool enough, and looking at the tree.
So so food.  Seriously,  nothing special. Hate the atmosphere.  Fly's everywhere.  No air conditioning inside. I will NEVER go back.

Fresh, delicious meals straight from the farm! They have sandwiches, salads, shakes and ribs! I tried the BBQ Pork Sandwich and a oversized portion of onion rings. I was super full but couldn't say no to the best onion rings on the planet!   My boyfriend order a full rack of ribs and finished the meal by licking his fingers clean. I liked the outdoor seating and view of the family farm. I know this restaurant has been approved by Guy Fieri of Diners Drive-ins and Dives, but just so you know it's Lauren Lizzle approved, as well.

I like this place. Bbq sandwich is good. They have homemade drinks, soda, lemonade and root beer, very delicious. I always get their cornbread it's very tasty, sides are made fresh.  The chocolate chip cookies are bomb but a little pricy. On your birthday you get free $10 to eat.  Can't say it's the best bbq I ever had but still very good.
Loved the burgers and the onion rings were fabulous!  This place is a must visi if you are in the Phoenix area anytime soon!

I'll get straight to the point. The pepperoni pizza wasn't any better than frozen, microwaveable pizza I've bought at the market. All I could taste was the charred crust. Maybe it was our fault for not getting their house specialty BBQ chicken pizza, but if they char the crust on that as much as they did w/ this, then I'll pass on that as well. The description actually states that there's a slight char (since they grill the pizzas), but I would hardly describe our pizza as being slightly charred. All we could taste was the char.  The Fontina burger was good. The veggies were fresh (as they are grown basically in the backyard of the restaurant) and each bite was just tender and savory. I really enjoyed it.  The onion rings were crispy and flavorful, but I wouldn't get the chili cheese fries again. Nothing special there.  They have a ribs and waffles combo that I'd want to try if I were to ever return.  BTW, interesting bathroom. That's all I'll say about that.
Love me some Joes Farm Grill! Such a fun environment and a great local feel! The food is always so awesome! Wish it were a little less pricey, but I get it and will always go back!

I'm giving this newly renovated place a 4 simply because in the few times that we've come back there has been one specific little prick that takes orders that cannot be bothered to greet customers appropriately; the line is freaking out the door and I literally wait while this guy turns away from us & starts a new convo with the girl next to him whom is trying her hardest to ignore him and actually do her job! I ask him "are you done now?" And he stares blankly at me &  says "yeah". As my boyfriend is giving his order he turns to the line cook guy and starts talking to him!!! He didn't put the correct order, but luckily the screen faces you as you order so we made sure he corrected his careless mistake! The food here is delicious, a bit pricey so I honestly hope they work on their order taker because everyone else is pretty on it. The managers are super friendly and walk around, checking in. Cool place especially when it isn't 347 degrees outside and you can let your child run around
Yummy burgers and welcoming ambience!  Such a treat!  Lives up to the Diners Drive Ins and Dives fame!
I liked the idea, but i got the shrimp and it wasn't the greatest.  I think trying the hamburger may be a better idea next time.

There is a reason this place always has a line to order your food. It is so good! No matter the time of day, you can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Joe's Big Breakfast is the best - the pancakes especially are uber delicious. For lunch or dinner, I would highly recommend the Chicken Pesto Sandwich. Drool. Yum.

I came here with a friend and the toddler. We all enjoyed the ahi, the sweet potato fries and something else unmemorable, but not bad. Everything was good and as we sat and ate we looked over the menu and thought about what we'd like to have next time. The toddler had a ball running around the grassy hills afterwards playing. We were hoping the produce stand would be open but we were there the wrong time of year. Isn't that always the case? We'll be back Joe.  We'll be back.
Love the fresh local food! Everything from the staff to the food is wonderful! I make a point to eat here every time I'm back in Gilbert!

Been here several times in the past and always very good, but tonight was  disappointing.  Got there around 6:30p, waited in line for approximately 40 minutes to be told they ran out of veggie burgers at 7:10 p.  Being vegan, my wife and I have limited choices and  their veggie burger is one of very few choices we can have and it's excellent.  We found a few other items we could have and they were good but not what we really wanted. When I spoke to the manager and asked how they could  run out of veggie burgers around 7p, but have plenty of regular beef burgers,  his response was something to the affect that it was almost 7:30, getting late, and  they had a supply and ran out;   As a professional, his response was unprofessional.  When I asked if he could compensate us in some way, he stated there was not much he could do. We  told him we are vegan, we had limited options and he tried to offer us salmon or a milkshake!    Usually I would give the restaurant 4 stars but tonight Customer service was poor.

Above average food does not justify mediocre service. The women taking our order was clearly distracted to the point of being flippant when we ordered a pizza that is one of their staple menu items. She informed us that they were all out. When I pushed further wondering if they had  run out of pizza she said "just out." She had no good explanation just a literal shoulder shrug. We ordered from the BBQ options and burger options. Never received our beet salad.  This was not a busy weekend night, it was Monday.  We tried to give them a chance to redeem their poor service when returning to order a milkshake and once again complete disappointment.  We'll try again sometime with hopes that we get the A team next time. WWGFD? (What Would Guy Fieri Do?)
The food is delicious, and fresh. A great place to sit outside and enjoy Arizona's beautiful weather during the Fall and Spring.
Amazing food, great service.  Really, have no complaints.  Their sweet potato fries and burgers are our favorite.  The portions are fairly big so we end up splitting most meals.

My favorite are the breakfast tacos! Everything I've tried here has been delicious. A little pricy but worth it especially every once in a while. They have a lot of grass space for kids to run around and some trees that even I want to climb... Not sure if they actually let you climb them.

Stick to breakfast or brunch for this place. Dinner ain't that great. Had veggie pizza....no flavor or zest to it...at least it was not greasy. Also sample the bbq pork...meh at best. I wish they should have used a better sauce. Though the fried zucchini and the ginger ale was good. Seriously sticking to breaky.
As an update, dark chocolate milk shake + french fries for the win!!!
Everything was delish but on the pricey side. Tried the BBQ platter , grilled salmon , sweet potato fries , garlic fries , chicken strips and beat salad

I have visited Joe's Farm Grill several times and I always leave happy. The food is fresh and tasty. The wait can be long at peak times, but there is a nice grassy area with picnic tables to sit at while you wait (when the weather is nice). I ate breakfast at Joe's once, and it was great.

This place is frickin awesome!!! I could write a whole page on this, but I love the atmosphere and I love the food and the prices are pretty good, but the vibe and atmosphere is the best. The staff is second to none, unbelievable. This place must breed great employees at all of their restaurants. I look forward to going back many times.

This is one of my favorite burger places in the greater Phoenix area that is a must stop when I'm in town.  I found this restaurant from watching Diners Drive-ins and Dives which had never led me wrong.   I wish I could give a more in depth review but this is one of those places where I get the same thing every time I go. I always have gotten the cheeseburger with fries and a Coke. A family member of mine tried the onion rings and claimed that they were the best he has ever had.   Definitely will be back.

What a disappointment!  We came here after seeing a posting on FB giving the fried pork tenderloin an excellent review.  Being originally from IL, my husband and I are always looking for places to get this beloved sandwich.  I wish I had my phone with me when we were served this greasy, stomach upsetting mess.  The pic would have proven what we got was not even close to the sandwhich pictured on FB.   First of all, the fried coating was not the normal golden crunchy as all tenderloins are.  The coating was an odd darker brown with pools of grease settling in the dips.  It was literally sliding off the pork due to the amount of grease between the meat and the coating.   I really think this tenderloin had been cooked earlier then when we ordered it the chef threw it back into the fryer that was filled with inadequately temperatured oil.  All this for almost $18 (2 cokes and 1 sandwich) The manager was unavailable....will be sending an email!

Love the food. Been coming once every couple months for years now. Favorites are the shrimp plate and the Sonoran dog.   But please, please go back to decent soda. That new stuff is cute and I'm sure very organic, but it's just not working. The diet cola (the only diet option) tastes awful. It and many of the other flavors foam up like a science fair volcano. Seriously, it's like 20% liquid, 80% foam, 100% lame. So much it would be funny if I hadn't paid $3 for a drink. I get the organic angle, but that stuff is too far.

Ambience = A++; It really is a beautiful setting and the perfect place to go when the weather turns nice.  We even drove around the neighborhood a bit to get the lay of the land.  I hadn't been in that area since it was all farmland in the 80s.    Food = B; We both had burgers.  There really wasn't anything special about them, which is not to say they weren't good... they were.  I'm more than willing to go there again and try something different - something more "authentically Joe's".  The fries were again, unimpressive.  The drinks were a little on the bland side; my first go was a Dr. Pepper which was flat.    Service was relatively quick for how many people were there.  My husband said the bathrooms were pretty awesome.
Excellent fried shrimp with crispy (cornmeal?) batter; cute decor and friendly employees.

I was here from out of town visiting friends and one of them recommended coming here.  I had been eating fast food for days it felt like so I did want something that was a bit "healthier".  I liked the concept and thought everything was pretty well made.  I had the Ahi tuna burger and it was perfect - good amount of tuna, done perfectly rare, etc.  I also got beets on the side.  It was quite a lot of food.    I thought the prices were reasonable enough - the only odd thing was it was kind of an in between restaurant -  it wasn't fast food since you had to wait for the food, but it wasn't a sit down restaurant either.

The food is good and ambience is nice. The problem is the restaurant has a fly issue. My wife and I were eating outside and we got swarmed with flies. I had to take my food to go. Flies also entered the restaurant and were in the kitchen. This definitely ruined my Friday night experience

this place is like having picnic only you dont have to bring the food.   Its fresh all their produce and meat w/ the  exception of the tuna come locally or from their organic farm. ITs fresh, fast and relaxing there. i love eating outside. it has a huge tree that is awsome that you can sit under, but becareful, there is a sgn that says falling scorpians. but if it does fall down maybe they could fry it up for you! hehe.

I was here over the weekend while visiting family in Phoenix.  The food was great, very fresh, reasonably priced and it was a perfect atmosphere for families with kids or even a date.  I wish we had one in my part of the country, but for now, I'll just plan to make it a stop again when I'm in town next time.  I had a cheeseburger, fries and a chocolate shake and it was all that I could wish for!!

I was so disappointed by this place. I had heard so many good things and decided to try it out. I asked for my burger well done and got a medium rare burger and then got a sassy response when I took it back. When I finally did get my food it wasn't even that great! Did we just catch them on a bad day? Maybe. But it was enough to make me not want to go back.

I can not say enough good things about this place!! We love the food (chicken fingers are a family fav) and the environment. We don't care for dill in our ranch but that's manageable! Very family friendly!!

Go-to items include: seared ahi sandwich and crispy chicken basket. Chicken bAsket is not to be mistaken for the traditional tenders you get. These are actually large pieces of juicy breast with panko breading. Pretty awesome. The Caesar dressing is also extra anchovy-y which is the way it should be. Ask for it on the side to savor the flavor.   I'm not big on the BBQ even though its sister location specializes in it and is carried over to their menu. It's nothing special to me. I like Rudy's BBQ better.   Need to come when the date shake is in season. Sounds interesting to try.   Avoid coming on weekend nights, line too long.

Great place for lunch, transport yourself back in time to this quaint farm grill which offers high quality food, fresh ingredients, killer burgers and an atmosphere that is one of a kind.  Good place for breakfast as well.  Family owned restaurant goodness.  Only drawback is the line, however good things come to those who wait.
Brought dogs to the grass after the dog park! Food is excellent. Excellent food, to reiterate!! Great location!

This place was far from where my friend stayed (West Side), but it was worth a trek out.  The place is clean and the food is made fairly quickly even with the lunch crowd.  On a hot day, you can sit outside under the misters, but I'm from Cali, so this AZ heat it not for me, even under the misters.  Food: Fontina burger with blue cheese was fresh.  The burger was juicy and full of flavor.  The blue cheese definitely enhanced it.  I like the different options for your sides.  The garlic fried were a big too greasy.  The beet salad is a nice refreshing touch.  The strawberry cheesecake from scratch that is not on the menu was just OK.  The fried okra was overly fried.  The BBQ pork sandwich looked tasty and my friend enjoyed it.    Bottom line: I enjoyed the food and it's worth a try.

As a Gilbert resident I feel liked it's almost my duty to like this place, but's just plain overrated. 30 minute wait for cold fries, dry ribs, soggy pork. The coleslaw was actually pretty good. Gilbert has much better options, this is for tourists who don't know any better.

Love Joe's!  We took the kids for a late dinner, the weather was just right for burgers, fries and a shake.   The burger was fresh, the tuna was cooked just right, medium rare and the Garlic fries were worth the trip itself.   My only complaint for this trip was that I forgot to order the Garlic Fries and when I asked the girl at the window if I could add the fries to my order which was almost ready she said that I would have to go back through the long line. I mean come on, really.       Update:  I was contacted today by the manager who addressed the issue i had with the Garlic Fries.  To be honest it was not a show stopper, I just wanted to be fair and include the entire experience.  I was impressed with the Manager's effort and concern for good service.  I added an extra star based on this.  Thanks for reaching out Anthony!  Joe's is a very hip, relaxed, progressive (for Phoenix that is) and fun little dive and when the weather is right makes for a perfect ending to a busy work week.

The hot dog was small and rested in an oversized dry bread roll. The burger was generic at best. The onion rings were amazing. The shakes were generic at best and undrinkable while using a straw; they don't offer spoons so don't order a chunky shake or prepare to take it home to get a spoon. The food was overpriced and generic. The dining area was infested with mosquitos and I was bitten 5 separate times within a 45 minute meal.  In short, not worth my time and not worth the hype.

I came here almost a year ago but never wrote a review. This place serves hot, fresh food. They grow the food on the land behind the restaurant. It was so good that I went back multiple times to try different items on the menu. It's a bit of a drive from Tempe but I think it's worth the drive.

One of my favorite places. There's so much variety on the menu, you should be able to please anyone. I've never had anything I didn't love from here.   The staff is very friendly, and they are usually timely getting your order out. If you're here on the weekend or other peak times, you'll probably be waiting in line for a while to order. I've waited as long as 1hr08min on a Saturday or Sunday lunch.   There is indoor and outdoor seating; most of the outdoor seating is large picnic tables under beautiful trees looking out to the neighborhood farm where the restaurant gets most of its produce.   My favorites: Pesto Chicken Sandwich, Fontina Burger, Ahi Salad, Garlic Fries  The shakes are amazing, too.

This place is fantastic, it's a hidden gem! We keep going back for breakfast but need to try it for lunch as well. You wait in line to order and receive a buzzer for when you're food is ready, then pick it up at the window. So it's efficient and you're not dealing with a waitress. I've only ordered their Breakfast Tacos with sausage, they're delicious with great flavor. They come with a side of beans that's unexpectedly great for breakfast. The seating is very casual and kid friendly, you can sit inside or outside. The place is always full because their food is so good - I would definitely recommend!

i went on saturday for dinner; line times went like this: from the cashier to the door: 20 minutes. from the door to the T of the sidewalk, 25 minutes.   good atmosphere with nice people sitting about outside on the picnic tables. lots of kids playing chase and such, too.  burger with mushrooms/bacon: good (but pricey for a basic burger) onion rings: good!. fries: neh. you've got to season them yourself. peanut butter banana thing: excellent. date shake: decent? it's more like a milkshake with date shavings rather than a date shake.  the food is good for the price (albeit a little pricey). the wait sort of kills it unless you're the type to pine with anticipation to whet your appetite? that's fair...pretty much...given that there's only one ordering station and for a large-ish-looking facility, one grill station.   interesting note: you get a buzzer after you order for pick-up notification. works out by the back trees.
Good food good service and they do a lot for the community, if you enjoy eating here also try Joe's Barbeque. Same owner

Saw the episode of Diners Drive Ins & Dives, and was very disappointed with the food both times we have gone there.  First time we went for breakfast but it was close enough to lunch that I ordered a burger.   The burger was way under cooked and the garlic fries had about 1/4" of oil sitting in the bottom of the tray.  We decided to go again last night for dinner knowing that the food had to be better, but we left pretty unsatisfied with the quality of the food, and the care in preparation/presentation of the food.  I ordered the hot dog with the pulled pork on it and my wife ordered the garden burger.  The garden burger, according to my wife, lacked any true flavor on it's own.  Very thin and the whole sandwich just looked like some beginner cook put it together.  My hot dog was warm at best, the bbq pork was just thrown on there with some type of scooper and had cole slaw just dumped on top of that.  The bbq pork tasted like it was from the day before and the temp also matched that.  We paid $27.00 for both our meals and 2 sodas, for that price, I expect that they take more pride in the making of the food and at least make sure it is served hot.
